0.title: DJ Khaled receives H'wood Walk of Fame star; Jay-Z, Fat Joe attend ceremony
0.article_body: DJ Khaled on Monday was honoured with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. The ceremony was attended by several celebrities, including Jay-Z, Diddy and Fat Joe. The 46-year-old American DJ is the 2,719th celebrity to receive a star on the walkway. "There's only one Khaled, that's all I gotta say," Khaled said during his speech.

1.title: Fire breaks out at DU's Ram Lal Anand College; fire tenders on spot
1.article_body: Five fire tenders have been rushed to the spot after a fire broke out at Delhi University's (DU) Ram Lal Anand College on Tuesday. Delhi Fire Services Director Atul Garg said that the fire was reported at the college around 8.55 am. The firefighting operation is ongoing and no casualties have been reported in the incident so far.

2.title: Elderly couple murdered in Assam on suspicion of witchcraft; 1 arrested
2.article_body: An elderly couple was on Monday murdered in Assam's Baksa district on suspicion of them practicing witchcraft. "During preliminary interrogation, the accused confessed that he suspected the couple of being involved in witchcraft and casting spells on his family," a police officer said. As per reports, the accused's wife, who was suffering from some ailments, didn't recover despite treatments.

3.title: A person admitted running over someone's foot: Vidya on response to 'Jalsa'
3.article_body: Discussing the reactions to her film 'Jalsa' which is about a hit and run accident, actress Vidya Balan said she received a message from a person who admitted to running over someone's foot. "They...[fled] because...there were a lot of women in the car, and they didn't feel secure about stopping in the middle of the night," added Vidya.

4.title: UK probing claims of Russian chemical attack in Ukraine
4.article_body: Britain is "urgently" trying to verify reports that Russia has used chemical weapons in Ukraine's Mariupol, UK Foreign Secretary Liz Truss said. "Any use of such weapons would be...callous escalation in this conflict and we'll hold [Russian President] Vladimir Putin and his regime to account," she added. Ukrainian lawmaker Ivanna Klympush had said Russia used an "unknown substance" in Mariupol.

5.title: Decomposed body of 9-yr-old missing boy found in Ludhiana
5.article_body: The decomposed body of a nine-year-old boy, who reportedly went missing six days back, was found at a vacant plot in Ludhiana on Sunday. According to police, the child was probably murdered. They have also found injury marks on his body. His post-mortem report will reveal the exact cause of death, police said. He lived with his father and stepmother.

6.title: Bengaluru CCB officers to wear waterproof jackets, caps during raids
6.article_body: Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant released the uniforms for the officers of the Central Crime Branch (CCB). The uniform includes a waterproof and reflective jacket, cap, shoes and other items which the officers will have to compulsorily wear during raids and other investigations. The jacket and cap were designed by CCB officers who also consulted with designers, an official said.

7.title: Heat wave warning issued for 7 states/UTs over 5 days, list released
7.article_body: IMD issued heat wave warning for seven states/UTs over five days. Heat wave to severe heat wave conditions are likely over Rajasthan andÂ UP from April 12 to 15. Haryana, Delhi and Punjab are likely to witness such conditions on April 12. Heat wave conditions are likely over Jharkhand on April 12-13, and over MP over next five days.

8.title: Miss you nani: Priyanka shares throwback pics from grandmother's b'day
8.article_body: Priyanka Chopra, taking to Instagram, shared some throwback pictures from her grandmother's birthday. "She helped raise me while my mom and dad balanced studying and medical careers," she wrote, adding, "She was a hugely consistent part of my upbringing. I feel so lucky...I had so many strong maternal figures in my life. I'm so grateful for you all. Miss you...Nani."

9.title: There are days when you want to hang up your boots: Priyamani
9.article_body: 'The Family Man' actress Priyamani said there are days when she wants to hang up her boots and just be herself for one day. "I want to eat whatever I want to. I don't want to look good," added Priyamani. Talking about social media, Priyamani stated that there are people who tell her that her body is looking fat.

10.title: When India sees tight Russia-China links, that'll obviously impact its thinking: US
10.article_body: After the US was asked about India's stand on Russia's war in Ukraine, it said, "When India sees the tight links between China and Russia, that's obviously going to impact their thinking." "We know that India has concerns about links between Russia and China. India...is facing a very tense situation along the Line of Actual Control," the US added.

11.title: Twitter did right by its staff: Executive on Musk not joining firm's board
11.article_body: Twitter's Director of ML Ethics, Transparency, and Accountability Rumman Chowdhury responded to Tesla CEO Elon Musk not joining Twitter's board saying the firm did right by its employees. "Musk's immediate chilling effect was something that bothered me significantly," she said. "People like him thrive on attention...I am glad to have joined a company that...is responsive," Chowdhury added.

12.title: Clashes began when students objected to havan on Ram Navami: JNU administration
12.article_body: The JNU administration has said the "scuffle" on Ram Navami began with some students objecting to the holding of 'havan' inside Kaveri Hostel, an allegation first made by the ABVP. Students on the Left, however, had alleged that the ABVP had first indulged in violence as they did not want non-vegetarian food to be cooked and served in the mess.

13.title: India will make its own decisions: US after PM Modi-Biden meet on war in Ukraine
13.article_body: After Prime Minister Narendra Modi and US President Joe Biden's virtual meeting on Russia's war in Ukraine, the US said, "India will make its own decisions, but we're going to continue the discussions." The US said this after a journalist said, "India has obviously been among the nations that had been more reticent to speak out against the war."

14.title: AAP dissolves its Himachal Pradesh working committee amid defections
14.article_body: Himachal Pradesh's Aam Aadmi Party state working committee has been dissolved, party's election in-charge for the state Satyendar Jain tweeted. "The new state working committee will be reorganised soon," he added. This comes after AAP's Himachal Pradesh president Anup Kesari, general secretary organisation Satish Thakur, Mahila Morcha chief Mamta Thakur and others joined BJP.

15.title: 65 years too early an age for someone to retire: CJI Ramana
15.article_body: With nearly four months left in his tenure as judge of the Supreme Court, CJI NV Ramana said 65 years is âtoo earlyâ an age for someone to retire. August 26 is his last day in office as CJI. âIn the Indian judiciary, we know our date of retirement at the time of joining. There are no exceptions,â Ramana added.

16.title: 38 cows killed as fire breaks out at cow shelter in Ghaziabad's Indirapuram
16.article_body: At least 38 cows at a cow shelter were charred to death after a fire from nearby shanties spread to a cow shelter in Ghaziabad's Indirapuram. The cows were kept on leash and workers found it difficult to reach them, a fire official said. Several cows have sustained burn injuries and are currently being treated at a veterinary hospital.

17.title: US orders non-essential staff to leave Shanghai over COVID-19
17.article_body: Amid stringent curbs owing to COVID-19 surge in China's Shanghai, the United States has ordered its non-essential embassy employees to leave the city. An embassy spokesperson said that the diplomats have raised concerns about the safety of US citizens with the Chinese government. Notably, the Shanghai administration has kept crores of residents under strict lockdown.

18.title: 4 injured in CNG cylinder blast in Delhi's Mayapuri
18.article_body: Four people were injured in a CNG cylinder blast in a house in Delhi's Mayapuri area on Monday afternoon, DCP (West) Ghanshyam Bansal said. "Enquiry revealed that the building owner used to purchase used CNG cylinders," he added. "The spot inspection revealed that one side gate and inside the stairs of the premises were damaged," police added.

19.title: 5 policemen killed in terrorist attack in Pakistan
19.article_body: As many as five policemen were killed after terrorists reportedly carried out a rocket attack in the Dera Ismail Khan district of Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa on Monday. According to the police, the terrorists fired a rocket at a police van and then started heavy firing. A senior police official was seriously injured in the incident.

20.title: Washington Sundar likely to miss SRH's next two games due to hand injury
20.article_body: SRH all-rounder Washington is likely to miss their next two games in the ongoing IPL season after suffering split webbing in his bowling hand. "I'd imagine it'd take probably a week or so to settle down," stated coach Tom Moody. Washington has picked four wickets and has scored a total of 58 runs in his four games this season.

21.title: BSF seizes 4 kg heroin dropped by drone along border in Punjab
21.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) said on Monday that it has seized nearly 4 kg of suspected heroin from five packets dropped by a drone along the International Border in Punjab's Tarn Taran. The drugs were recovered from between the barbed wire fence and the zero line. A BSF spokesperson said that the drugs were concealed in a white polybag.

22.title: India's monthly Russian oil purchase less than what Europe buys in 1 afternoon: EAM
22.article_body: Amid criticism of India's purchase of oil from Russia, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said India's total monthly purchase of oil from Russia is probably less than what Europe does in an afternoon. While responding to a journalist, Jaishankar said, "I would suggest that your attention should be focused on Europe." He was speaking at the India-US 2+2 ministerial dialogue.

23.title: Punjab man claims to be single on passport; wife files complaint
23.article_body: A man from Punjab's Ludhiana was booked on Monday following a probe over seven months for allegedly furnishing false data while renewing his passport by claiming to be single. The man's wife had filed a complaint. The investigation had found that the man got married in 2019 and his divorce case was pending in a court, a police sub-inspector said.

24.title: If someone takes stand against non-veg food it's not wrong: Athawale on JNU clash
24.article_body: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale on Monday said that Ram Navami is a holy festival for Hindus and if someone takes a stand to not eat non-veg food then it's not wrong. His comment came following the clash at JNU. "Whatever happened in JNU wasn't right and shouldn't have happened...All ideologies must be accepted. Culprits should be booked," Athawale stated.

25.title: 1,000 surveillance cameras to be installed across Gurugram this year
25.article_body: The GMDA will install 1,000 new surveillance cameras at 200 locations across Gurugram this year, officials said. The GMDA is planning to install automatic number plate recognition cameras, facial recognition cameras and general surveillance cameras. Areas proposed for cameras' installation include Golf Course Extension Road, stretches between sectors 80 and 95, and Manesar, the officials added.

26.title: Colombian police rescue over 1,000 animals in anti-smuggling operation
26.article_body: Colombia's national police have rescued over 1,000 animals, including ocelots, snakes and birds, valued at more than $1 million on the black market, authorities said. Twenty-one people have been arrested in the nationwide operation, supported by the US Fish and Wildlife Service and local environmental authorities, Colombian police said. The animals are now in the care of environmental authorities.

27.title: Miley Cyrus' mother Tish files for divorce from Billy Ray Cyrus after 28 years of marriage
27.article_body: Miley Cyrus' mother Tish Cyrus has filed for divorce from Billy Ray Cyrus after 28 years of marriage, according to court documents. She filed for divorce on Wednesday in Williamson County, Tennessee, citing "irreconcilable differences" as the reason for the filing. This is the third time Tish Cyrus and Billy Ray Cyrus have filed for divorce, according to 'People' magazine.

28.title: I think SRH bowled well in last 5 overs: Hardik after 1st defeat of season
28.article_body: After suffering their first defeat in the ongoing IPL season, GT captain Hardik Pandya said SRH bowled well in the last five overs to restrict them to 162/7 after 20 overs. "We were 7-10 runs short, [these runs] would have made difference in the end," he added. GT lost three wickets and scored 44 runs in the last five overs.

29.title: 796 new COVID-19 cases, 19 deaths reported in India in last 24 hours
29.article_body: India has reported 796 new COVID-19 cases, 946 recoveries and 19 more deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country reported 861 COVID-19 cases and six deaths. India's active caseload currently stands at 10,889, while the death toll reached 5,21,710.

30.title: Fan's banner reading 'If Hardik hits a 50, I'll resign from my job' goes viral
30.article_body: A picture of a fan carrying a banner reading 'If Hardik hits a 50, I'll resign from my job' during GT's IPL 2022 match against SRH has gone viral. "Hardik is such a legend. He got someone out while he was batting," a user tweeted, referring to Hardik's 50*(42). "The reason to why unemployment is increasing," another wrote.

31.title: Nirav Modi's close aide Subhash Shankar brought to India from Egypt: Reports
31.article_body: The CBI has deported Subhash Shankar Parab, a close aide of fugitive jeweller Nirav Modi, from Egypt and has brought him to Mumbai, said CBI officials. Parab had reportedly fled to Cairo in 2018 and was absconding ever since the â¹7,000 crore bank fraud case against Nirav came to light. He was the Deputy General Manager (Finance) at Firestar Diamond.

32.title: Indore Central Jail helps prisoners complete education, get degrees
32.article_body: The Central Jail of Indore is helping inmates complete their education and get degrees so that they can earn their livelihood after release. "At present 83 prisoners in jail are giving 10th and 12th exams...253 prisoners are appearing for graduation and post-graduation examination," Jail Superintendent Alka Sonkar said. Several subjects have been offered to prisoners by the jail.

33.title: Curtains put up outside Ranbir Kapoor's house for privacy ahead of rumoured wedding
33.article_body: Ahead of Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's rumoured wedding, a video showing curtains being put up outside the actor's house for privacy has been shared by Bollywood photographer Viral Bhayani. Workers were seen installing long white curtains in the video. Earlier, Ranbir's mother Neetu, when asked about the wedding, said, "I don't know about the big day myself."

34.title: 10% monthly growth was guaranteed: Ashneer as BharatPe CEO claims record growth
34.article_body: Former MD of BharatPe Ashneer Grover took to Twitter after CEO Suhail Sameer claimed that the company had posted record growth in the fiscal year ended March 31. Ashneer wrote, "Everyone loves March financial year ending. 10% month on month growth is guaranteed by the calendar; 31/28 days!" Suhail shared a LinkedIn post about the company's growth on Monday.

35.title: 4 drunk guests at Maha wedding stab groom's friend, bride's brother over music
35.article_body: Four drunk persons, who were angry at music being stopped at a wedding function in Maharashtra's Nagpur, allegedly stabbed and injured the groom's friend and the bride's brother, police said. "The music was stopped as the four had begun creating ruckus after getting drunk," a police officer said. The injured persons have been hospitalised, he added.

36.title: Yash visits Tirumala Venkateswara Temple ahead of KGF 2 release
36.article_body: Actor Yash on Monday visited Tirumala Venkateswara Temple in Andhra Pradesh. The visit comes ahead of the release of his action film, 'K.G.F: Chapter 2'. A few pictures of the actor offering prayers at the temple have surfaced online. The film, directed by Prashanth Neel, also stars Sanjay Dutt and Raveena Tandon and is set to release on April 14.

37.title: Still paying for a $116,000 Tesla I returned 2 years ago: US man
37.article_body: A US man, Danny Roman, claims he is still paying his bank for a $116,000 Tesla Model X that he returned over two years ago under a seven-day no-questions-asked return policy. Tesla had collected Roman's car in March 2020 and promised a refund. Roman's bank had asked him to get Tesla to initiate a "stop sale", which Tesla didn't.

38.title: Parents lock staff inside school after teacher thrashes students in Punjab
38.article_body: Angry parents locked the staff of a government primary school inside its building in Punjab's Sangrur after a teacher allegedly thrashed some students. They lifted the protest after the education department assured them that suitable action will be taken against the teacher by April 20. The teacher has been moved to another school temporarily, an education official said.

39.title: 19-year-old dies due to electrocution in Mohali's Chhat village
39.article_body: A 19-year-old youth died due to electrocution in Mohali's Chhat village on Sunday evening while removing a tent after a wedding party. The deceased, who was using an iron rod to remove the tent, was reportedly electrocuted after the rod came in contact with high-tension wires. He was rushed to a hospital where doctors declared him brought dead.

40.title: 5 killed as train runs them over in Andhra Pradesh's Srikakulam
40.article_body: Five persons died and others were injured after a speeding train ran them over in Andhra Pradesh's Srikakulam on Monday, police said. "Deceased were from Secunderabad-Guwahati Superfast Express...had gotten down onto adjoining track...Konark Express coming from opposite direction ran them over," police added. "Officials are reaching...to ascertain if there are more casualties," Srikakulam SP said.

41.title: Mumbai woman loses phone data by clicking suspicious WhatsApp link, gets threat
41.article_body: A 29-year-old Mumbai-based woman lost her phone data including her contact list and photographs after she clicked a WhatsApp link received from an unknown number. The complainant said that the fraudster asked her to pay money or else he would send her private photographs to her relatives. The fraudster had also sent the victim an image of her PAN card.

42.title: Court denies bail to Delhi riots case accused Sharjeel Imam
42.article_body: Former JNU student Sharjeel Imam, who is accused of conspiracy in the northeast Delhi riots, was denied bail by a Delhi court. The bail was denied by stating that the allegations against Imam are prima facie true. However, Imam's counsel argued that the allegations are untrue since Imam was arrested before the actual riots, which happened on February 24-25, 2020.

43.title: Russian Army using rape as weapon of war: Ukraine rights group to UN
43.article_body: A Ukrainian human rights group has accused Russian troops of using "violence and rape...as a weapon of war". Kateryna Cherepakha, President of La Strada Ukraine, told UN Security Council that her organisation's emergency hotlines had received calls accusing Russian soldiers of nine cases of rape, involving 12 women and girls. "This is just the tip of the iceberg," she said.

44.title: Let Muslims live peacefully: Karnataka ex-CM Yediyurappa
44.article_body: Calling for an end to communal violence, former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa on Monday said, "Let them (Muslims) live peacefully and respectfully." He said he has asked CM Basavaraj Bommai to ensure such incidents do not take place. "We hope that Hindus and Muslims should live like the children of the same mother," said the senior BJP leader.

45.title: Man falls to death from IAF helicopter during rescue mission on Jharkhand ropeway
45.article_body: A man fell to his death while being rescued by an IAF helicopter following the ropeway accident in Jharkhand's Deoghar district on Monday. A video of the incident shows the man who was being winched into the helicopter losing his grip and plunging hundreds of feet into the valley. At least 10 people are still stuck in cable cars.

46.title: Talks with Putin left no optimistic impression: Austrian Chancellor
46.article_body: Austrian Chancellor Karl Nehammer on Monday became the first European leader to visit Moscow and meet Russian President Vladimir Putin since the invasion of Ukraine began on February 24. However, Nehammer said his meeting with Putin left "no optimistic impression". He warned Russia's military was preparing a fresh offensive in eastern Ukraine, adding, "The battle will be fought with vehemence."

47.title: Umran Malik will play for India very soon: Michael Vaughan
47.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has said SRH's 22-year-old pacer Umran Malik will play for Team India very soon. "If I [were in] the BCCI, I would be sending him to play some county cricket this summer to help him develop," Vaughan added. So far, Umran has picked three wickets in his four games this season.

48.title: Meta to test tools for creators to sell digital assets in metaverse
48.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta will be testing tools for creators to sell virtual items and effects within its virtual reality platform Horizon Worlds. US and Canada users, 18 and above, will be allowed to purchase items in Horizon Worlds. Meta is also testing a creator bonus programme for US participants where creators will be paid monthly for their progress towards set goals.

49.title: PMC Assistant Commissioner, others held for taking â¹15,000 bribe
49.article_body: Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) arrested Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) Assistant Commissioner Sachin Tamkhede and two others on Monday for allegedly taking â¹15,000 as a bribe from a drainage contractor. Tamkhede had initially demanded â¹25,000 as a bribe from the contractor for sanctioning drainage work and concretisation bill, officials said. One of the accused was caught red-handed by the ACB.

50.title: Man plans murder after watching TV crime series in Pune, kills woman
50.article_body: A 46-year-old man was arrested for murdering a 42-year-old woman by sedating her through sleeping pills and later hitting her on the head in Pune, police said. The accused, who robbed the victim of her valuables, planned the murder after drawing ideas from a TV crime series, police added. "He needed money for his daughter's wedding," police stated.

51.title: Abbottâs FreeStyle Libre makes continuous glucose monitoring prick-free
51.article_body: FreeStyle Libre is a sensor-based continuous glucose monitoring device that helps people with diabetes track their glucose levels. This wearable product monitors glucose levels without finger pricks and calculates time spent in the desired range. It enables users make informed decisions on lifestyle modifications and dietary control, owing to the ease of sharing real-time data with experts.

52.title: CM Bommai inaugurates Bipin Rawat Freedom Park in Bengaluru
52.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai inaugurated Bipin Rawat Freedom Park in Bengaluru in memory of former Chief of Defence Staff General Bipin Rawat on Sunday. The park, situated at Padmanabhanagar, has been built at a cost of â¹2 crore and is spread over an acre of land. The park will also have an open gym for fitness enthusiasts.

53.title: Police search Bengaluru school over hoax bomb threat
53.article_body: The police on Monday conducted a combing operation at Bishop Cotton Girls' School in Bengaluru after receiving a bomb threat which turned out to be a hoax. This comes days after similar threats were received by at least 15 schools in the city. "Our teams along with the dog detection unit and canine squad rushed to the spot," said police.

54.title: SRH's Rahul Tripathi gets injured while hitting six, video goes viral
54.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) batter Rahul Tripathi got injured while hitting a six on the bowling of Gujarat Titans (GT) all-rounder Rahul Tewatia on the first delivery of the 14th over. Tripathi was seen falling to the ground on his follow through after hitting the six over wide long-off. He was retired hurt for 17(11).

55.title: Which batters are the fastest to reach 100 sixes in IPL history?
55.article_body: GT captain Hardik Pandya on Monday became the fastest Indian to reach 100 sixes in IPL history, taking 1,046 deliveries. KKR all-rounder Andre Russell is overall the fastest cricketer to reach 100 sixes in IPL, taking 657 deliveries. He is followed by Chris Gayle, who took 943 deliveries to reach the milestone.

56.title: Let's talk sometime: Koo CEO to Musk after he decides to not join Twitter board
56.article_body: Soon after Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal announced Elon Muskâs decision to not join the companyâs board, the CEO of Koo, the  Indian microblogging website, reached out to Musk. Aprameya Radhakrishna wrote, "Let's talk sometime! We're young, agile and dreaming big! Koo is being built as the future of social media. Your specific point on democratised verification is already done btw."

57.title: Faridabad man steps out of car to relieve himself, dies after falling into manhole
57.article_body: A 24-year-old man died after allegedly falling into an open manhole in Faridabad. The man and his two friends were returning in their car after dropping a friend, when he fell after stepping out to relieve himself. "The manhole was over 20-foot-deep and had water up to 10 feet...This is negligence on part of the authorities," his father said.

58.title: 7 students test COVID-19 positive in 2 Ghaziabad schools
58.article_body: Two schools in Ghaziabad were shut after seven students tested positive for COVID-19, health department officials said. A school in Indirapuram reported two positive cases, while five children were found positive at another school in Vaishali, the officials further informed. So far, 68,815 COVID-19 vaccine doses have been administered to children in the 12-15 age group in the district.

59.title: Hardik Pandya gets angry at Mohammad Shami, abuses him; video goes viral
59.article_body: GT captain Hardik Pandya got angry at Mohammad Shami and abused him for not attempting a catch while fielding in the deep against SRH. Reacting to the video that went viral, a fan tweeted, "Hardik's temper tantrums during tight situations have been outright cringe."  Another wrote, "Stop taking it out on your teammates, particularly someone as senior as Shami."

60.title: We are monitoring rise in human rights abuses in India: US
60.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken has said, "We are monitoring some recent concerning developments in India including a rise in human rights abuses by some government, police and prison officials." Blinken said this during a joint press briefing with US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin, Indian Foreign Minister S Jaishankar and Indian Defence Minister Rajnath Singh.

61.title: Britney Spears announces pregnancy, says 'If 2 are in there, I might just lose it'
61.article_body: Singer Britney Spears has announced she is having a baby with partner Sam Asghari, saying, "I lost so much weight to go on my Maui trip only to gain it back...I thought Geez...what happened to my stomach???" "So I got a pregnancy test...and uhhhhh well...I am having a baby...If 2 are in there...I might just lose it," she further said.

62.title: Communal violence breaks out in Mumbai; over 25 vehicles vandalised
62.article_body: Two incidents of communal violence were reported in Mumbai on Sunday. In Mankhurd, over 25 vehicles were vandalised after a fight broke out between two groups belonging to different religions. Seven persons were arrested in two FIRs registered in this connection. In Malwani, 25 persons from BJP and Bajrang Dal were booked for carrying out a procession without prior permission.

63.title: Honest tax collection could have saved Delhi civic bodies: SC panel
63.article_body: An honest tax collection could have saved the Municipal Corporations of Delhi (MCDs), a Supreme Court-appointed panel said. If agencies had taken coercive action in C-type tenements like Amar Colony, â¹729.7 crore could have been realised, the panel's report added. "If agencies are honest in collection of charges from properties...amount realised will be [enough] to run local bodies," it stated.

64.title: SRH hand GT their first defeat in IPL 2022, win 2nd match in a row
64.article_body: SRH chased down a 163-run target in 19.1 overs to hand GT their first defeat in IPL 2022. SRH, who had lost their first two matches in the tournament, have now won two matches in a row. Captain Kane Williamson top-scored for SRH in the match with 57(46). GT have now dropped to the fifth position on the points table.

65.title: Russia claims it hit Ukrainian S-300 air defence systems
65.article_body: Russia on Monday claimed that it has hit four S-300 air defence systems in Ukraine, amid claims by the Ukrainian government of an impending Russian offensive in the country's east. Russian forces had retreated from the country's north recently. A senior US official on Monday said that Russia has started reinforcing and resupplying its troops in Donbas in eastern Ukraine.

66.title: Hope Russia-Ukraine talks will pave way for peace: Modi at India-US summit
66.article_body: PM Narendra Modi during India-US virtual summit with US President Joe Biden expressed hope that ongoing talks between Russia and Ukraine will pave way for peace. "Our talks today are taking place at a time when situation in Ukraine remains very worrying," Modi said. He added India and US are natural partners as the world's two largest and oldest democracies.

67.title: India lose 0-3 to Netherlands in junior women's hockey World Cup semi-final
67.article_body: India lost 0-3 to Netherlands in the semi-final match of the FIH junior women's hockey World Cup in Potchefstroom on Sunday. India were trailing 0-1 at the end of the third quarter, but two back-to-back goals by the Netherlands' players in the fourth quarter pushed the scoreline to 0-3.

68.title: Musk may buy more shares in Twitter, express views on social media: Filing
68.article_body: World's richest person and Twitter's largest shareholder Elon Musk has updated a regulatory filing regarding his stake in Twitter after rejecting the offer to join its board. As per the filing, Musk may acquire additional shares in Twitter and may express his views through social media. He was earlier limited from owning over 14.9% stake in Twitter as board member.

69.title: He has helped me a lot: SRH's Abhishek on working with batting coach Lara
69.article_body: Crediting SRH batting coach Brian Lara after scoring 75 runs against CSK in IPL 2022, SRH opener Abhishek Sharma said, "He told me, in particular, to just think positively...be wise with picking the balls (to go after)." He added, "I just followed that and it has helped me a lot." Abhishek had scored nine and 13 in first two matches.

70.title: Don't feel it left huge scars: Djokovic on the Australian Open controversy
70.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic has said that he doesn't feel that the recent Australian Open controversy "has left huge scars" on him. "I don't feel it (the Australian Open incident) has left huge scars that I'm unable to train or participate in tournaments or live my life...far from that," Djokovic said.

71.title: No untoward incident in WB on Ram Navami: CM Mamata Banerjee
71.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Monday said that the state did not witness a single untoward incident on Ram Navami this year, while several were reported from different parts of the country. She further said that many festivals are held in the state, but West Bengal has never witnessed an untoward incident.

72.title: 25 dead in landslides and flooding caused by storm in Philippines
72.article_body: Landslides and floods caused by tropical storm Megi have left at least 25 people dead in the Philippines, authorities said on Monday. At least six people are missing and rescue operations are being carried out to find them, an official said. Notably, Megi is the first storm to hit the country this year, which sees around 20 such storms annually.

73.title: Which players have been retired out in International cricket?
73.article_body: In international cricket, three batters have been retired out so far. During a Test between Sri Lanka and Bangladesh in September 2001, Sri Lanka's Marvan Atapattu and Mahela Jayawardene were retired out after scoring 201 and 150, respectively. Bhutan's Sonam Tobgay was retired out in a T20I against Maldives on December 7, 2019 after scoring 24(35).

74.title: 22-year-old woman, brother held for killing her mother-in-law in Guj
74.article_body: A 22-year-old woman and her brother were arrested for allegedly killing her 53-year-old mother-in-law in Gujarat's Surat on Sunday, police said. According to the police, the woman, along with her brothers was leaving her house on April 10 when her mother-in-law stopped them. Upon being stopped, the woman and her brother killed the 53-year-old before locking the house and leaving.

75.title: Poland blames Russia for 2010 crash that killed then-Polish Prez
75.article_body: A Polish government commission has blamed "unlawful interference" by Russia for the 2010 plane crash that killed then-President Lech Kaczynski and 95 others. "The main...proof of...interference was an explosion in the left wing...followed by an explosion in...plane's centre," the commission's head said. The plane had crashed near Russia's Smolensk and the victims included senior military figures.

76.title: Russia asks Google to remove 'dead Russians' translation option
76.article_body: Russian communications regulator Roskomnadzor has asked Google to remove "threats against Russian users" after it said Google Translate offered some users the option to translate "dead Russians" instead of "dear Russians". It said Google did not offer such suggestions in the 'Did you mean' section for other nationalities. Google has also been asked to explain the reason behind such suggestions.

77.title: How do you know if she was raped or had affair?: Mamata on minor's gangrape
77.article_body: Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee reacted to the death of a 14-year-old girl after being allegedly gang-raped in Nadia. Banerjee asked, "How do you know if she was raped or was pregnant or had a love affair?...Even family knew it was a love affair." She added, "If a couple's in a relationship, how can I stop them? This isn't UP."

78.title: PM Modi congratulates new Pak PM, says 'India wants peace in terror-free region'
78.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday congratulated newly-elected Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif. He said, "India desires peace and stability in a region free of terror so that we can focus on our development challenges and ensure the well-being and prosperity of our people." Sharif was elected as the PM after Imran Khan was removed through a no-confidence motion.

79.title: German minister resigns over controversial vacation after floods
79.article_body: German Family Minister Anne Spiegel resigned from her post on Monday following controversy over her vacation, which she took shortly after floods hit Rhineland-Palatinate last year, where she was a senior official. She cited "political pressure" as her reason to resign. Spiegel became the first minister to quit Chancellor Olaf Scholz's federal government since he assumed power in 2021.

80.title: Shehbaz Sharif takes oath as 23rd Prime Minister of Pakistan
80.article_body: Shehbaz Sharif took the oath as 23rd Prime Minister of Pakistan on Monday, replacing Imran Khan. Sharif was administered the oath by Senate chairperson Sadiq Sanjarani after President Arif Alvi complained of 'discomfort'. Earlier in the day, the 70-year-old was elected as the country's new Prime Minister after securing 174 votes in the parliament.

81.title: Meesho fires 'a small number' of employees from grocery vertical
81.article_body: Meesho on Monday said that it has laid off "a small number of full-time roles and certain third-party positions on six-month contracts" from its grocery business, Meesho Superstore. According to reports, around 150 employees have been affected by the restructuring. The social commerce startup said it will offer severance packages and outplacement assistance to those impacted by the move.

82.title: Hopefully can thrill with few wickets here, there: Hazlewood to RCB fans
82.article_body: After joining RCB camp in IPL 2022, pacer Josh Hazlewood said, "Just a message for the 12th man army- really excited for this season, hopefully can thrill you guys with a few wickets here...there and a few wins." Pacer Jason Behrendorff, who also joined the camp, said he can't wait to get his first opportunity to play in the team.

83.title: Extremely happy with how SA pitched: Elgar on their 2-0 Test series win
83.article_body: Following South Africa's 2-0 Test series win against Bangladesh, South Africa captain Dean Elgar said he's "extremely happy" with how everyone pitched for the last two Tests. "Lot of tough styles of plays had to be implemented and something we are not familiar with," he stated. South Africa won the second and final Test by 332 runs.

84.title: Congress issues show-cause notices to KV Thomas & Sunil Jakhar
84.article_body: Congress' disciplinary action committee on Monday issued show-cause notices to party's ex-Punjab unit chief Sunil Jakhar and former Union Minister KV Thomas. Jakhar was issued notice for his alleged remarks against ex-Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi, while Thomas was sent one for attending CPI(M)'s event in Kannur. Jakhar and Thomas have been given one week's time to respond to notices.

85.title: Nadal plays every point very strictly like it's his last point: Ruud
85.article_body: On playing against Rafael Nadal, world number seven Casper Ruud said the 21-time Grand Slam champion plays every point "very strictly" and in order as if it's his "last" point. "I've heard him say that many times before...that's the reason he never gives you room to breathe," he stated. "He sets up the point very well," Ruud further said.

86.title: 'Bullet train of crime' running in UP in BJP's 2nd term: Akhilesh
86.article_body: Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav while commenting on UP's law and order situation said that a "bullet train of crime" is running in the state. He added, "In the second term of...BJP...criminals are more fearless...Incidents of bank robbery, locker theft, rape, shooting and murder are taking place unabated." He further stated the CM has no control over the administrative machinery.

87.title: Method acting used as excuse for inappropriate behaviour: Will Poulter
87.article_body: Actor Will Poulter has stated that method acting shouldn't be used as an excuse for inappropriate behaviour, adding that it definitely has been used as one. "When it comes to an actor's process...so long as it doesn't infringe on other people's...then fine. But if your process creates an inhospitable environment then...you've lost sight of what's important," the actor added.

88.title: Man sleeping on footpath in Odisha stabbed to death, wife critical
88.article_body: A 23-year-old labourer died and his wife was critically injured after they were stabbed while sleeping on a footpath with their one-year-old son in Odisha's Bhubaneswar on Sunday. "The murder seems to be fallout over quarrel on petty issues," police said, adding, killing someone sleeping on footpath in Bhubaneswar isn't very common. Police registered a murder case against unknown people.

89.title: Tiger found dead in Karnataka's Bandipur National Park
89.article_body: A seven-year-old tiger was found dead in the Omkar range of Karnataka's Bandipur National Park on Sunday. Its nails and other organs were found intact by officials who visited the spot and the forest department attributed the death to a fight with another tiger. The carcass was burnt as per the National Tiger Conservation Authority guidelines following a post-mortem.

90.title: Guangzhou closes to most arrivals amid China's major COVID outbreak
90.article_body: Authorities in Guangzhou have imposed restrictions on most arrivals to the city amid a growing COVID-19 outbreak in China. Only residents with a "definite need" to leave Guangzhou can do so, and only if they test negative for the virus within 48 hours of departure, an official said. Primary and middle schools in the city have switched to online classes.

91.title: 1 dead, 3 hospitalised after consuming toddy in MP's Dhar
91.article_body: A 50-year-old man died, while three others including a 15-year-old boy fell ill, after allegedly consuming toddy in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district on Friday. Police have denied that the four consumed spurious liquor. Hamir Singh died in a hospital while his wife and the other two are hospitalised and their condition is out of danger, police added.

92.title: Only 28 people invited to Ranbir & Alia's wedding: Alia's brother Rahul Bhatt
92.article_body: Only close friends and family members have been invited to Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's reported wedding that is to take place in April, Alia's half-brother Rahul Bhatt has revealed. The wedding will have only 28 guests, Rahul said, adding that the guests will be taken by a bus to RK Studios where the couple will reportedly tie the knot.

93.title: Filmmaker Guneet Monga gets engaged to entrepreneur Sunny Kapoor
93.article_body: Film producer Guneet Monga, who has produced films like 'The Lunchbox', 'Masaan' and 'Pagglait', on Monday announced her engagement to fashion entrepreneur Sunny Kapoor. Sharing the pictures of her engagement on Instagram, Monga wrote, "Sometimes the wrong train leads you to the right station." She added, "And thatâs where I found Sunny, my companion on our journey ahead for life."

94.title: Makers had planned 'Kung Fu Yoga 2', but COVID-19 happened: Sonu Sood
94.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood has revealed that 'Kung Fu Yoga' makers had planned a sequel to the 2017 film and the script was being written. "But then...COVID-19...came, and lots of things have happened, especially in China also," he added. "Hopefully, when everything settles down...I hope it happens soon," he said. Sonu collaborated with actor Jackie Chan for the 2017 film.

95.title: India, US to sign MoU to protect each other's satellites at 2+2 talks
95.article_body: India and the US will sign a memorandum of understanding (MoU) in the field of Space Situational Awareness (SSA) during the 2+2 Ministerial Dialogue. Through the agreement, the two countries will share data to protect each other's satellites from man-made or natural threats. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar are in the US for the meeting.

96.title: Gavaskar asks British commentator about Kohinoor during IPL match, video goes viral
96.article_body: While talking about Marine Drive being called the Queen's necklace, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar jokingly told British commentator Alan Wilkins, "We are still awaiting the Kohinoor diamond." "If you do have any influence, maybe you can pursuade the British government to return the Kohinoor," he added. "Savage," a fan commented on the video.

97.title: TCS' attrition rate continues to rise, hits 17.4% in January-March
97.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) announced that its employee attrition rate continued to rise during the January-March quarter, reaching 17.4%. "The reported attrition number of 17.4% will get worse for the next couple of quarters just because of the way LTM attrition is calculated," CEO Rajesh Gopinathan said. "But...on a month-on-month basis...we're starting to see flattening of it," he added.

98.title: We've thought it through: Shahid Kapoor on 'Jersey' being postponed
98.article_body: Talking about his film 'Jersey' being postponed, actor Shahid Kapoor has said, "We obviously have thought it through. Everybody thinks it's prudent." He added, "A lot of big films can be released on a holiday and...'Beast' is largely for...different market...'KGF 2' is an action film. We're very much a family film. So, the genres are very different."

99.title: 77-yr-old widow gets possession of her house in MP after 27 years
99.article_body: A 77-year-old woman in MP's Indore, whose now-deceased husband was fighting for 27 years to get their house freed from their tenant, finally received its possession on Monday. The local administration had to break the lock and take out the tenant's belongings from the house as the latter hadn't handed over the possession despite the notice being given on Sunday.

100.title: IAF helicopter sets record, flies Chandigarh to Assam non-stop in 7.5 hrs
100.article_body: An Indian Air Force (IAF) heavy-lift Chinook helicopter has set a record by completing a non-stop sortie from Chandigarh to Jorhat in Assam. The helicopter completed the 1,910-kilometre route in seven and a half hours. The Chinook is a multi-role vertical lift platform and also plays an important role in humanitarian and disaster relief operations.

101.title: 50 youth Congress workers arrested during protest in Indore
101.article_body: At least 50 MP Youth Congress workers were arrested in Indore on Monday for protesting against unemployment and irregularities in recruitment exams, police said. The workers, including the state youth wing's chief Vikrant Bhuria, were arrested when they tried to jump over barricades to enter the collectorate, an official said. "They...were arrested as a precautionary measure," the official added.

102.title: Article 355 should be imposed in WB: BJP leader on Nadia rape case
102.article_body: Amid the ongoing row over the Nadia rape case that happened last week, West Bengal Leader of Opposition and BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari on Monday said that Article 355 should be imposed in the state. "I met Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar and sought a probe on the alleged gang rape death of the 14-year-old girl in Nadia," he said.

103.title: I was surprised with his ability: Rahman on Tiger singing 'Miss Hairan'
103.article_body: Composer AR Rahman has stated that he was pretty surprised with actor Tiger Shroff's ability to emote and give a drive to 'Heropanti 2' song 'Miss Hairan'. Tiger had made his singing debut in 2020 with the song 'Unbelievable' which also featured on the Billboard Top Triller Global charts. Tiger has earlier called himself a bathroom singer.

104.title: I hope people don't judge her: Kangana on Mandana's abortion
104.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut took to Instagram Stories to respond to a fan's tweet praising the way she handled Mandana Karimi's confession of getting an abortion after a secret relationship with a well-known director. Kangana wrote, "'Lock Upp' is a celebration of both beauty and brutality of life...I hope people don't judge her. Life is anyway not easy for a woman."

105.title: Rajnath & US counterpart hold talks at Pentagon ahead of 2+2 dialogue
105.article_body: Ahead of the India-US 2+2 dialogue, Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh met US Secretary of Defence Lloyd J Austin III at the Pentagon and held delegation-level talks. Austin welcomed Singh in an enhanced honour cordon ceremony. Singh and External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar arrived in Washington on Sunday for the fourth edition of the annual dialogue.

106.title: GoTo shares jump 23% on first trading day post $1.1 billion IPO
106.article_body: Indonesian technology firm GoTo's shares surged as much as 23% on the first day of trading after it launched one of the world's biggest IPOs and raised $1.1 billion. GoTo's shares closed 13% higher at 382 rupiah, valuing the company at about $31.5 billion. GoTo was formed in 2021 in a merger between ride-hailing giant Gojek and e-commerce firm Tokopedia.

107.title: Every second you protest we're losing dollars: SL PM to people amid economic crisis
107.article_body: Amid widespread protests in Sri Lanka over the worst economic crisis the country has seen since Independence, PM Mahinda Rajapaksa appealed to the people to end protests. Saying that the government is working round-the-clock to resolve the crisis, Rajapaksa said, "Every second you protest on the roads, we are losing dollars."

108.title: Croatia expels 24 Russian Embassy staff over Ukraine invasion
108.article_body: Croatia on Monday told 24 Russian Embassy staff, including 18 diplomats, to leave the country over Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Croatia joins other European countries, including France and Germany, which also expelled Russian envoys after reports of atrocities against civilians surfaced from Ukraine's Bucha. "Russia will give an appropriate response," its foreign ministry spokeswoman said.

109.title: He keeps things lighthearted within team: Shami on GT head coach Nehra
109.article_body: Stressing on the importance of a good atmosphere within the franchise, GT pacer Mohammad Shami said head coach Ashish Nehra keeps things lighthearted even during difficult situations. "So far, it has been very good [in IPL 2022], the atmosphere is great as well. When you come into a new franchise, an atmosphere has to be created from scratch," he added.

110.title: Probe links between Muskan & 'unseen hands' behind hijab row: BJP MP
110.article_body: BJP MP Anantkumar Hegde wrote to Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai demanding an investigation into "possible links" between the student Muskan Khan and "unseen hands" behind the hijab row. He claimed that Muskan's act of standing in defence of the hijab had become global news and that several Muslim organisations rewarded her, followed by praise from Al-Qaeda chief Ayman al-Zawahiri.

111.title: Putin earns $1 billion a day from oil alone: Zelenskyy's economic adviser
111.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin "earns $1 billion a day from oil alone", Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's economic adviser, Oleg Ustenko, said. Ustenko urged countries to impose an embargo on Russian oil's transportation. "Some European nations are concerned...[about] inflation...However, the market will undergo a rapid correction, and prices will return to acceptable levels," he added.

112.title: Stoinis could've taken LSG deeper had he come to bat early: Tendulkar
112.article_body: Commenting on Marcus Stoinis (38*) batting at number eight against RR in IPL 2022, Sachin Tendulkar said if the LSG all-rounder had come to bat one-two numbers early then he could've taken the match deeper. He added that it was LSG's strategy to send Stoinis lower down the order. Chasing 166-run target, LSG lost the match by three runs.

113.title: Worked with Shiv Kumar Subramaniam twice, he was exceptional: Anil Kapoor
113.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor on Monday took to Twitter to condole the death of actor-screenwriter Shiv Kumar Subramaniam. He wrote, "I had the opportunity to work with Shiv first in 'Parinda' and then in '24' and both the times he was exceptional. An excellent actor who will be truly missed." Shiv passed away two months after his 15-year-old son's demise.

114.title: Shiv Sena does politics in name of Lord Ram, not BJP: Raosaheb Danve
114.article_body: Union Minister Raosaheb Patil Danve on Monday said that Shiv Sena does politics in Lord Ram's name and not the BJP. "Shiv Sena has sold their Hindutva patent to Congress and NCP. BJP doesn't politicise in the name of Ram," he said. Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday said that BJP keeps communal issues at the forefront of politics.

115.title: Hardik Pandya becomes fastest Indian to smash 100 sixes in IPL history
115.article_body: GT captain Hardik Pandya has become the fastest Indian to smash 100 sixes in IPL history. The 28-year-old all-rounder achieved the feat after smashing a six off SRH's Aiden Markram on Monday. Pandya took 1,046 balls to reach 100 sixes. DC captain Rishabh Pant was the previous fastest Indian to reach 100 sixes in IPL, taking 1,224 balls.

116.title: Ashwin breaks silence on retiring out, says 'T20 is a team game like football'
116.article_body: Opening up on retiring out against LSG, RR's Ravichandran Ashwin said, "[Cricket] is a team game that we often forget in...euphoria...It's an important aspect of the game we haven't considered." He added, "It's almost as much as football. Goal-scorers are like...opening batters or wicket-takers...They're worth it only if your goalkeeper or defenders are ready to do what it takes."

117.title: TRAI releases recommendations for 5G auction; shares reserve price
117.article_body: The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) on Monday released recommendations on the 'Auction of spectrum in frequency bands identified for IMT/5G'. It recommended a significant cut in the reserve price for the 5G spectrum. "Telecom Service Providers should be allowed easy payment options including part payment with the flexibility of moratorium," TRAI recommended.

118.title: Shooting climax portion of 'KGF 2' was toughest: Cinematographer
118.article_body: Cinematographer Bhuvan Gowda has revealed that shooting the climax portion of 'KGF: Chapter 2' was the toughest task while filming. "I had to retain the natural ambience while showcasing the epic face-off between Yash's Rocky and Sanjay Dutt's Adheera," he stated. "Filming for Chapter 2 was...big challenge as we had to meet the expectations of the audience," Bhuvan added.

119.title: Might come out with glimpse of Prabhas' 'Salaar' in May: Prashanth
119.article_body: Filmmaker Prashanth Neel, speaking about his upcoming film 'Salaar', has said that they might come out with a glimpse of the movie when they begin shooting for the next schedule in May. "The movie is an action thriller, and Prabhas...hasn't looked like this before. His fans are going to be...happy with the look we have for him," Prashanth added.

120.title: PM Modi must realise there's poverty on both sides, let's fight it together: Pak PM
120.article_body: Newly-elected Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif on Monday said, "I'll advise (Indian) PM (Narendra) Modi to understand that there is poverty on both sides (of the border)." He called upon PM Modi to resolve the Jammu and Kashmir issue, adding, "Then let's fight poverty together". Good ties with India cannot happen without a peaceful resolution on Kashmir, he said.

121.title: ISIS supporter found guilty of murdering British MP David Amess
121.article_body: A supporter of the Islamic State (ISIS) has been found guilty of murdering British MP David Amess on Monday. Ali Harbi Ali, a British citizen, had repeatedly stabbed Amess inside a church as the lawmaker was meeting with voters in October last year. Ali had claimed that his attack was in response to the lawmaker's support for airstrikes on Syria.

122.title: Sweden's Social Democrats to review party policy on NATO membership
122.article_body: Sweden's ruling Social Democrats party will review its security policy amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, it said on Monday. The discussions will include whether or not the country chooses to apply for NATO's membership. The Social Democrats, which is Sweden's largest party in parliament, had rejected earlier calls to join NATO, citing the need for the country's continued military non-alignment.

123.title: 'Want democracy to flourish there': Mufti on Pakistan political crisis
123.article_body: Amid Pakistan's ongoing political crisis, former Chief Minister of Jammu and Kashmir Mehbooba Mufti on Monday said that she wants democracy to flourish in India's neighbouring country. Mufti had previously alleged that BJP was trying to destroy J&K's economy and "oppress" the people, but PM Narendra Modi was "watching silently," adding that she has "no hopes from him".

124.title: India declares 2019 Pulwama attack accused Mohiuddin Aurangzeb a terrorist
124.article_body: The Union Home Ministry on Monday declared the Pulwama terror attack accused Mohiuddin Aurangzeb, belonging to the Jaish-e-Mohammed, a terrorist under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act, 1967. At least 40 CRPF personnel were killed in the attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama in 2019. The Centre said Mohiuddin is involved in anti-India terror activities on behalf of banned outfit JeM.

125.title: Viral video shows tourists from Gurugram driving Audi through Ladakh's Pangong lake
125.article_body: A video showing tourists driving an Audi along the shallow end of Ladakh's Pangong Tso has gone viral online. The video of the black Audi with a Gurugram number plate also shows foldable chairs and a table with alcohol bottles and food placed along the lake's shoreline. Netizens called the video "shocking" and "shameful" and also sought action.

126.title: Adani Green becomes India's 10th most valued firm with â¹4.22 lakh crore m-cap
126.article_body: Adani Green Energy has surpassed Bharti Airtel to become the 10th most valuable company in India. The company's shares surged 20% on Monday to hit an all-time high of â¹2,786.20 on NSE. Its market capitalisation now stands at â¹4.22 lakh crore. Earlier this month, Adani Group became India's third conglomerate to cross a market capitalisation of $200 billion.

127.title: Langer considering offer of joining England as head coach: Report
127.article_body: Former Australia head coach Justin Langer is considering joining England as the team's head coach, a report by the Daily Mail said. This comes after Chris Silverwood stepped down as England's head coach after a 0-4 loss at the Ashes. Earlier, former cricketers Nasser Hussain and Adam Gilchrist had backed the thought of Langer joining England as a head coach.

128.title: Can't achieve good relations with India without Kashmir issue resolution: Pak PM-elect
128.article_body: Pakistan's Prime Minister-elect Shehbaz Sharif has said that he wants good relations with India, but it can't be achieved without the resolution of the Kashmir issue, news agency PTI reported. Pakistan's Parliament elected Opposition lawmaker Shehbaz Sharif as the countryâs new Prime Minister on Monday. The 70-year-old PM-elect is the brother of Pakistan's former Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif.

129.title: Tens of thousands killed in Mariupol amid Russian siege: Ukraine
129.article_body: Tens of thousands of people have likely been killed in Mariupol during a Russian siege, President Volodymyr Zelenskyy told South Korean lawmakers. A local official said that the number of people leaving Mariupol had declined due to Russian forces slowing down pre-departure checks. Separately, Ukraine claimed that Russian forces are massing for a new offensive on eastern areas.

130.title: Nitish became Bihar CM due to BJP's 'Reham-o-Karam': Tejashwi
130.article_body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav, while asserting that his party will win the Bochaha by-poll seat, said that Nitish Kumar became Bihar CM in 2005 because of BJP's 'Reham-o-Karam'. He added, "People know that the CM is running a circus instead of running the govt. They're not working on issues of the state, failing to fulfil promises."

131.title: Rename UP's Sultanpur to Kushbhawanpur: BJP MLA to CM Yogi
131.article_body: BJP MLA from Sultanpur Vinod Singh, in a letter to UP CM Yogi Adityanath, said his constituency must be renamed as Kushbhawanpur. Sultanpur has many religious places which stress the belief that Kush, Lord Ram's son, developed it as his capital and called it Kushbhawanpur, Singh said. "Later, Khilji Badshah named it as Sultanpur for promoting his culture," he added.

132.title: Hyderabad-based startup launches foldable electric bicycle
132.article_body: Hyderabad-based startup company 'Kachbo Design' launched a first-of-its-kind electric bicycle on Sunday. The 'Hornback' bicycle can be folded and carried inside a car or even be pushed around like a trolley. Jayesh Ranjan, the principal secretary for Telangana's IT, Industries and Commerce department, said that e-bicycles will be added to the state's e-vehicle policy.

133.title: SRH to bowl first against unbeaten GT, both teams unchanged
133.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) captain Kane Williamson won the toss and elected to bowl first against Gujarat Titans (GT) in their IPL 2022 clash on Monday. Both the teams are playing with an unchanged playing XI. GT are currently third on the points table and are the only unbeaten side in the tournament so far. SRH are eighth on the table.

134.title: It'll be different feeling: Rashid ahead of GT's game vs his ex-team SRH
134.article_body: Ahead of GT-SRH in IPL 2022, GT spinner Rashid Khan said it'll be a different kind of feeling to play against his ex-team, which he represented for five years. "Bowling to someone like Kane Williamson is always a huge pleasure as a bowler. We had a good five years together...now against each other...it's a lovely contest," he added.

135.title: Congress expels ex-MLA Surjit Dhiman for 'anti-party' activities
135.article_body: Ex-Congress MLA Surjit Singh Dhiman was expelled from the partyâs primary membership for alleged "anti-party" activities on Sunday. The move came after Dhiman reportedly questioned the appointment of Gidderbaha MLA Amarinder Singh Raja Warring as Punjab Pradesh Congress Committee's (PPCC) new chief. Meanwhile, Congress stated that expulsion orders were issued against Dhiman for his "indiscipline".

136.title: Happy that Ranbir, Alia are fulfilling Rishi's dream: Subhash Ghai
136.article_body: Reacting to Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's wedding, filmmaker Subhash Ghai has said he is happy that Ranbir and Alia are fulfilling Rishi Kapoor's dream. "In January 2020...I had gone to meet Rishi at his home...He was so happy to share...that they were planning his son Ranbir's marriage with Alia in December 2020 in a big way," Subhash stated.

137.title: We are backing him here fully: Pant on DC teammate Kuldeep
137.article_body: Talking about Kuldeep Yadav, who has been part of all four matches that DC have played so far, captain Rishabh Pant said they're fully backing the pacer. "Kuldeep has been working for one year but hasn't been getting chances," he added. Kuldeep didn't play a single game for KKR in IPL 2021. He took four wickets against KKR on Sunday.

138.title: No one will be allowed to take law into their own hands: K'taka CM
138.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Monday said the government will not tolerate violence and no one will be allowed to take law into their own hands in the name of religion. The government is not against anyone propagating his or her ideology, Bommai said. He added that his government wants to speak through actions and not through words.

139.title: Shiv Kumar Subramaniam got me my 1st writing credit: Anurag Kashyap
139.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap on Monday took to Instagram to mourn the demise of actor Shiv Kumar Subramaniam. He wrote, "Shiv...asked...to also put my name as the writer's credit [in 'Auto Narayan']. That's how I got my first screenwriting credit." Anurag further wrote, "I owe so much of what I am to Shiva Dada...The most generous, beautiful man I've known."

140.title: Ukraine's economy to shrink by 45.1% due to war in 2022: World Bank
140.article_body: Ukraine's economy will contract by 45.1% this year due to conflict with Russia, the World Bank said on Sunday. It also said that the Russian economy will shrink by 11.2% due to financial sanctions imposed in response to the invasion. "Our forecasts show that the Russian invasion...has reversed the region's recovery from the pandemic," a senior World Bank official said.

141.title: Grateful, humbled that 2 of my films are in â¹1,000cr club: Rajamouli
141.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli has stated that he is grateful, humbled and overwhelmed that he has two films, 'Baahubali 2' and 'RRR', that have entered the â¹1,000 crore club. "The success of both 'Baahubali 2' and 'RRR' has reiterated that a film based on human emotions can cut geographical boundaries and translate beyond the language," the filmmaker added.

142.title: Members of AISA detained for protesting against JNU violence in Delhi
142.article_body: Police detained members of the All India Students Association (AISA) for protesting outside Sardar Patel Bhawan, against the violence that broke out between two groups in JNU. "Women protesters were manhandled and their clothes were pulled by male security personnel. Several protesters also got injured. We have been detained inside the Tughlak Road Police Station," AISA activist Neha said.

143.title: Man told by boss to 'send wife for a night' if he wanted transfer in UP, kills self
143.article_body: A UP Power Department employee died by suicide after he was allegedly told by a Junior Engineer to 'send his wife for a night' if he wanted a transfer. The 45-year-old set himself on fire outside the engineer's office in Lakhimpur Kheri and died during treatment. The man had recorded a video saying he'd complained but no action was taken.

144.title: Young filmmakers have faith in their actors: Satish Kaushik
144.article_body: Actor Satish Kaushik has said that young filmmakers know the importance of time and have faith in their actors. "They offer you a complete script before the shoot begins and conduct workshops and readings with actors before the film goes on floors," he stated. "All this ensures...they don't waste time during the shoot...explaining what they want," Satish further said.

145.title: Hardik seems to be relishing his role as captain for GT: Harbhajan
145.article_body: Ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh said that Hardik Pandya seems to be "relishing" his role as Gujarat Titans' captain in IPL 2022. "He's performing with the bat for GT and has also started bowling well which are good signs for Team India as well," he added. GT have won all three matches they have played so far.

146.title: TCS hires record 1,03,546 employees in 2021-22
146.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) on Monday said that it made a record hiring by adding 1,03,546 employees in the financial year ending March 2022. "In Q4, TCS added 35,209 employees on a net basis, the highest ever net addition in a quarter," TCS further noted. It added that IT services attrition continued to climb and reached 17.4% during the quarter.

147.title: Meet the 'miniature kangaroo': UK zoo on pics of rare newborn dusky pademelon
147.article_body: A baby dusky pademelon was finally spotted peeking out from his mother's pouch at the Chester Zoo in the UK a few months after birth. Sharing a glimpse of the baby pademelon on social media, the zoo wrote, "Meet the new 'miniature kangaroo' here at the zoo!" Pademelons are born just the size of a jelly bean, the zoo said.

148.title: Indian husband-wife, who each have unicorn startups, plan first startup IPO
148.article_body: Indian husband-wife Ruchi Kalra and Asish Mohapatra, who each built their own billion-dollar startups OfBusiness and Oxyzo Financial Services, are planning their first IPO. OfBusiness, a supplier of raw materials to small businesses, could go for an IPO in six months to a year, Co-founder Kalra said. The couple's other unicorn Oxyzo could float shares in two years, she added.

149.title: Pune's SPPU demands equal rights for disabled students, set up centre
149.article_body: Pune's Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) has become the first state university to approve the establishment of a centre for mental health and disabilities, to ensure inclusive education for all. It has been established to respond to the needs of a community that people turned a blind eye to, said Chetan Diwan, Chairman, Board of Studies, Disability Studies at SPPU.

150.title: Delivery boy murdered over old enmity in Mira Bhayandar, 2 arrested
150.article_body: Two men, who were out on bail, allegedly murdered a 26-year-old food delivery man in Maharashtra's Mira Bhayandar in an act of revenge. The victim was apparently taken to an abandoned area before being bludgeoned to death with stones. "Both the accused who have a history of committing serious offences, executed this murder to settle scores of...previous enmity," police said.

151.title: Devotee dies due to electrocution at ISKCON temple in Mumbai
151.article_body: A devotee died due to electrocution at the ISKCON temple in the Juhu area of Mumbai, police said on Monday. Police have arrested the contractor and registered a case of negligence against him after the incident. However, it is yet not clear how the devotee got electrocuted, the Juhu Police added.

152.title: It's okay to be a plus-size person, I block the trolls: Priyamani
152.article_body: Actress Priyamani in an interview has stated that it's okay to be a plus-size person, adding that being happy is of the utmost importance. She further said that trolls feel that they have the authority to say whatever they want to say. "Certain times a few comments are too harsh to digest. I straight away block such trolls," Priyamani added.

153.title: Lukaku, Barkley, Callum, Chilwell won't play vs Real Madrid: Tuchel
153.article_body: Chelsea manager Thomas Tuchel said Romelu Lukaku, Ross Barkley, Callum Hudson-Odoi and Ben Chilwell will not be available for the Champions League Round of 16 fixture against Real Madrid at the Santiago BernabÃ©u. "Callum...Chilwell [are] out. Romelu will not travel...due to the pain in his Achilles...Barkley is sick...will not travel," Tuchel said. The second-leg match will be played on Tuesday.

154.title: Microplastics in Cauvery may be harming fish: IISc Bengaluru study
154.article_body: Microplastics and other pollutants may be causing growth defects in fish in the Cauvery river, as per a study by the Indian Institute of Science (IISc) in Bengaluru. The defects include skeletal deformities. For the study, water samples were collected from three different locations with varying speeds of water flow.

155.title: Auto, cab drivers in Delhi demand subsidy on CNG prices
155.article_body: Auto and taxi drivers in Delhi staged a protest outside the Delhi Secretariat on Monday demanding subsidy on CNG prices. General Secretary of Delhi Auto Rickshaw Sangh, Rajendra Soni, said the "unprecedented" price hike has broken the backbone of auto and cab drivers, adding that they would go on an indefinite strike from April 18 if their demands aren't met.

156.title: TCS records â¹50,591 crore revenue in Q4, net profit at â¹9,926 crore
156.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) revenue in Q4 FY22 grew 15.8% YoY to â¹50,591 crore, crossing the â¹50,000 crore mark for the first time. Its total revenue in FY22 stood at â¹1,91,754 crore, up 16.8% YoY. The company recorded net profit of â¹9,926 crore in Q4, a rise of 7.4% YoY from â¹9,246 crore in Q4 FY21.

157.title: Fighting Hindutva is major challenge for CPI(M): Sitaram Yechury
157.article_body: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury said on Monday that combatting the "Hindutva communal agenda" is a major challenge for the party. He further alleged that besides northern states, the northeast region of India is also becoming "rapidly and most dangerously communalised". Yechury's remarks come a day after he was re-elected as the party's General Secretary for a third consecutive term.

158.title: Mumbai Police band plays Egyptian song 'Ya Mustafa', video released
158.article_body: The Mumbai Police's band Khaki Studio on Monday released an instrumental cover of 'Ya Mustafa', a song composed by Egyptian musician Mohamed Fawzi. In the video, the band members can be seen playing the song using instruments like tenor saxophone, euphonium, flat clarinet, tuba and flute. Previously, the band released their version of the song 'Srivalli' from 'Pushpa: The Rise'.

159.title: Movie-going experience in India is exhilarating: Yahya Abdul-Mateen II
159.article_body: American actor Yahya Abdul-Mateen II in an interview has stated that the movies and movie-going experience in India are exhilarating for him. "The (aspect of the culture) is infused into one...spectacle [here]," the actor added. He further said that he is influenced a lot by that aspect. "I am indeed inspired by a lot of things from India," Yahya added.

160.title: MP govt bulldozes houses of those who pelted stones at Ram Navami procession
160.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh government on Monday started demolishing houses of those who pelted stones at a Ram Navami procession in Khargone on Sunday. A video shows bulldozers razing the houses of the accused. Earlier in the day, state Home Minister Narottam Mishra said that houses of those who pelted stones will be 'reduced to a pile of stones'.

161.title: Clash of students at JNU hostel is 'unfortunate': Delhi Home Minister
161.article_body: The clash of students at the Jawaharlal Nehru University's Kaveri Hostel was an "unfortunate" incident, Delhi Home Minister Satyendar Jain said on Monday. Asked about the incident by reporters, Jain said, "I am the Home Minister of Delhi. You should ask this question to the Home Minister under whom the Delhi Police is."

162.title: PTI lawmakers to resign from Pak's National Assembly: Imran Khan
162.article_body: Pakistan's former Prime Minister Imran Khan on Monday said that lawmakers from his party, Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI), will resign from the National Assembly amid a political crisis in the country. Shehbaz Sharif was elected as the country's new PM today. Imran Khan was removed as PM after he lost a no-trust vote against him after midnight on Sunday.

163.title: Hopefully, he gets in CSK halfway through IPL 2022: Hogg on Chahar
163.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said CSK need their pacer Deepak Chahar, who is currently recovering from a quadriceps injury, back in the team for the ongoing IPL. "Hopefully, he gets there halfway through the season," he added. He further said that Chahar's swing bowling in powerplay overs takes pressure off the other bowlers, especially the spinners in those middle overs.

164.title: Oil prices drop below $100 mark on China lockdown, release of reserves
164.article_body: Oil prices dropped below the $100 mark on Monday on plans to release record volumes of crude and oil products and on continuing lockdowns in China. Brent crude slipped $3.93 to $98.85/barrel while US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) fell $4.19 to $94.07/barrel. The International Energy Agency member nations, along with the US, will release 240 million barrels within six months.

165.title: Chennai software firm gifts cars to 100 employees for 5 years of service
165.article_body: Chennai-based software firm Ideas2IT on Monday gifted Maruti Suzuki cars to 100 employees who have worked for five years at the company. The decision of gifting cars was collectively decided by the employees, Murali Vivekanandan, who founded Ideas2IT in 2009, told Moneycontrol. "This (car) is what they have done. And, not for what they are going to do," Vivekanandan added.

166.title: Ready to enter politics if people want, says Robert Vadra
166.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's husband Robert Vadra said he is ready to enter politics if people want. "If people wish I should represent them and if I can bring some change for them, then I will definitely take this step," he added. When asked about the present political scenario in the country, he said he feels "uneasy".

167.title: Policeman dies by suicide after consuming poison in Gurugram
167.article_body: An Assistant Sub-Inspector posted at Pataudi police station in Gurugram district died by suicide after consuming some poisonous substance on Sunday, according to a PTI report. The policeman took the extreme step at home and died in a hospital. The policeman has accused senior officers of harassment in a suicide note, the report said.

168.title: India's consumption of petroleum products hits 3-year high in March
168.article_body: The total petroleum product consumption in March stood at 19.41 million tonnes, the highest since March 2019, according to the latest data from the Petroleum Planning and Analysis Cell of the Oil Ministry. Diesel, the most used fuel in the country, saw the demand rising by 6.7% to 7.7 million tonnes. Petrol sales were up 6.1% at 2.91 million tonnes.

169.title: 'Jersey' accused of plagiarism, case to be heard in Bombay High Court: Reports
169.article_body: Shahid Kapoor and Mrunal Thakur-starrer 'Jersey' has been accused of plagiarism by a writer named Rajneesh Jaiswal, reports said on Monday. Jaiswal has reportedly claimed that the movie's script/story belongs to him. The matter will be heard in Bombay High Court today, reports further said. The film's release has been postponed to April 22.

170.title: Jadeja, MSD are talking almost every day about CSK captaincy: Hussey
170.article_body: CSK batting coach Michael Hussey said Ravindra Jadeja and MS Dhoni talk about captaincy "almost every day". "Dhoni was the captain for such a long period...he has done an amazing job...great thing is that he's still here to help Jadeja...in his first year as captain," he added. Hussey further said that everyone in the team "highly" respects Jadeja.

171.title: Not much pressure if our score is over 200: Rishabh Pant
171.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) captain Rishabh Pant has said that the "pressure is not as much" if they post over 200 runs on the scoreboard. "In these conditions, when the dew is not there if teams score 170-180 it is decent and the pressure is not as much as it is when the score is 200 or more," Pant said.

172.title: Lee Jung Jae & Lee Byung Hun's characters to return in Squid Game 2
172.article_body: Hwang Dong-hyuk, director of South Korean survival drama series 'Squid Game', recently confirmed that Lee Jung Jae's character Seong Gi-hun and Lee Byung Hun's character Front Man will return in the next season of the show. "Gi-hun for sure. He'll be back and I believe the Front Man will be back too," Hwang said at an event.

173.title: Hate, violence weakening country: Rahul post Ram Navami violence
173.article_body: Responding to communal clashes that broke out in Gujarat during Ram Navami processions, which left one dead, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said that hate, violence and exclusion are weakening India. "The path to progress is paved with the bricks of brotherhood, peace and harmony. Let's stand together to secure a just, inclusive India," Rahul further said.

174.title: Karan Mahara becomes the new President of Uttarakhand Congress
174.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi appointed former Ranikhet MLA Karan Mahara as the new President of the Uttarakhand Congress unit. Mahara will take over the reins from former Srinagar MLA Ganesh Godiyal. Bajpur MLA Yashpal Arya has been appointed as the CLP leader while Khatima MLA Bhuwan Kapri, who defeated CM Pushkar Singh Dhami, is appointed as the deputy CLP leader.

175.title: This guy can lead: Shastri on Hardik Pandya's Gujarat Titans captaincy
