175.article_body: Ravi Shastri, speaking about Hardik Pandya's captaincy, has said, "Don't take your eye off...ball there guys. This guy can lead a side." "Right before this IPL...question that was asked about a lot of young captains, the word was KL Rahul, Shreyas Iyer, Rishabh Pant. Add Hardik," Shastri stated. Gujarat Titans have won all three matches in IPL 2022 so far.

176.title: Faf du Plessis should have been CSK skipper after MS Dhoni: Shastri
176.article_body: Ravi Shastri said Ravindra Jadeja should have played as a player in IPL 2022, whereas, Faf du Plessis should've been CSK skipper after MS Dhoni. "CSK should've not let Faf go because he's...match-winner and played a lot," Shastri stated. Faf was bought by RCB for â¹7 crore in the mega auction and is leading the franchise in IPL 2022.

177.title: Delhi govt to launch anti-open burning campaign from Tuesday
177.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Monday said the Delhi government will launch a month-long anti-open burning campaign from Tuesday to curb road dust pollution. Of Delhi's 17 city forests, four will be developed at "world-class level", Rai added. Delhi's PWD will set up a taskforce to map areas where green belt is required to be developed on roadsides.

178.title: Sri Lanka will opt for Constitutional means to oust govt: Oppn leader
178.article_body: Sri Lankan Opposition leader Sajith Premadasa has said that country will opt for Constitutional provisions to oust incumbent government amid economic crisis. "We will represent...citizens and...have an organic uprising but will ensure that [it is]...peaceful," he added. Thousands of Sri Lankans have been protesting against the government as the country grapples with food shortages and power cuts.

179.title: Shehbaz Sharif elected as Pakistan's new Prime Minister
179.article_body: Pakistan's Opposition leader Shehbaz Sharif has been elected as the country's new Prime Minister. The 70-year-old Pakistan Muslim League (N) chief is the former Pakistan Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif's younger brother. This comes after Imran Khan was removed as Pakistan's Prime Minister after he lost the no-trust vote against him in the National Assembly after midnight on Sunday.

180.title: Had affair with a well-known director, got pregnant but aborted it: Mandana
180.article_body: Mandana Karimi revealed on Sunday's episode of 'Lock Upp' that she was in a secret relationship with a "very well-known" director after her separation from her husband. She said the director is someone who "talks about women's rights and independence of women in the outside world", adding, "We planned pregnancy but when it happened, he completely backed off."

181.title: I'm enjoying GT captaincy, have become a better cricketer: Hardik
181.article_body: Gujarat Titans skipper Hardik Pandya has said that he's enjoying his captaincy and added he always wanted to have a responsibility as a cricketer. "That's the reason I have become a better cricketer because facing challenges makes you better," Hardik stated. With three matches played so far, Hardik's Gujarat Titans are the only unbeaten side in the ongoing IPL 2022.

182.title: Mumbai-Gandhinagar Shatabdi gets vistadome coach, Railways shares video
182.article_body: The Indian Railways has added a vistadome coach to the Mumbai- Gandhinagar Capital Shatabdi Express for a panoramic view. A video of the coach shared by the Railways shows passengers during the journey. "The large glass windows and glass roofs provide a panoramic view of the picturesque route," the Indian Railways wrote on Twitter.

183.title: Chahal argues with umpire after wide call, video goes viral
183.article_body: RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal was seen arguing with the on-field umpire after he signalled a delivery as wide during the 18th over of LSG's innings. The ball appeared to be inside the marker when it passed the stumps, with the commentators also terming the call as wrong. Chahal went on to dismiss Dushmantha Chameera off the next delivery.

184.title: Around 200 bouncers hired for Alia, Ranbir's wedding: Alia's half-brother
184.article_body: Speaking about  Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's wedding, the former's half-brother Rahul Bhatt said that around 200 bouncers are hired for the wedding. "Yusuf Bhai has taken over the security of Alia...and Ranbir Kapoor's wedding. He has Mumbai's best security force- 9/11 agency," Rahul said. He added guards will be deployed at both RK Studio and Vastu in Chembur.

185.title: Laws should be enacted after thorough debate & discussion: Om Birla
185.article_body: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Monday said the primary responsibility of the legislature is to fulfil the aspirations of the people while laws should be enacted after thorough debate and discussion. "Democratic institutions from Panchayat to Parliament should follow this," Birla said. He was speaking at the inaugural session of the 8th CPA India Regional Conference organised in Guwahati.

186.title: Ban the person for life if such things happen today: Shastri on Chahal's balcony incident
186.article_body: After Yuzvendra Chahal revealed a cricketer hung him from a 15th-floor balcony after getting drunk during IPL 2013, Ravi Shastri said, "It's the first time I am hearing such a drastic thing like this." He added, "If such things happen today, a life ban for that person involved and send that person to a rehab centre as quickly as possible."

187.title: Arjun Kapoor, Abhimanyu Dassani mourn demise of Shiv Kumar Subramaniam
187.article_body: Arjun Kapoor took to Instagram Stories to mourn the demise of actor Shiv Kumar Subramaniam, with whom he worked in '2 States'. "Rest in peace, Shiv sir. You'll be missed," he wrote with a broken heart emoji. Abhimanyu Dassani, who shared screen space with Shiv in 'Meenakshi Sundareshwar', wrote, "Will always cherish the evening walks with you...Rest in peace sir."

188.title: Crane that caused traffic jam in Delhi, Gurugram removed after 26 hrs
188.article_body: A crane that caused a traffic jam on the Delhi-Gurugram Expressway (NH-48) on Saturday has been removed after 26 hours. The police said that engineers from Mumbai had been called to repair and change the tyres of the crane to help it move. The crane had caused a traffic jam on the road for many hours after catching fire.

189.title: It's about being Rajasthan Royals: Sanju Samson on Ashwin getting retired out
189.article_body: Talking about Ravichandran Ashwin getting retired out against LSG in their IPL 2022 match on Sunday, RR captain Sanju Samson said, "It's about being Rajasthan Royals." He added, "We keep trying different things. We had been talking about it before the season. We thought...if some situation occurs, we can use it." He stated that it was a team decision.

190.title: Kuldeep's chances of Team India comeback have increased: Gavaskar
190.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said that DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav bowled exceptionally well against KKR, picking wickets at "crucial times" in the game. "The fact that he has now begun to pick wickets means that chances of him making a comeback to the Indian team also increases," added Gavaskar. Kuldeep picked four wickets, conceding 35 runs against KKR.

191.title: Jailed Hong Kong media mogul Jimmy Lai appeals to UN over cases
191.article_body: Imprisoned media mogul Jimmy Lai's lawyers are asking UN to investigate multiple criminal charges levied against him in Hong Kong, citing them as âlegal harassmentâ against him. Lai, who's also a pro-democracy activist and publisher of defunct Apple Daily newspaper, was charged under Hong Kong's national security law. He was initially arrested for participating in pro-democracy protests in 2019.

192.title: Who are the highest wicket-takers in IPL 2022 after 20 matches?
192.article_body: Following the conclusion of first 20 matches of IPL 2022, RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal leads the list of highest wicket-takers in the tournament with 11 scalps. He is followed by KKR's Umesh Yadav and DC's Kuldeep Yadav, who have taken 10 wickets each. RCB's Wanindu Hasaranga and LSG's Avesh Khan have taken eight wickets each in the tournament so far.

193.title: Man succumbs to injuries after stone-pelting incident in Jharkhand village
193.article_body: A man succumbed to his injuries following an incident of stone-pelting during a Ram Navami procession on Sunday evening in Hirhi village of Jharkhand's Lohardaga district, officials said, adding that 12 others have sustained injuries. Ten bikes and a pick-up van were set on fire during the violence, officials further said. Internet services have been suspended in Lohardaga town.

194.title: Pakistan stocks jump the most since 2020 after Imran Khan removed as PM
194.article_body: Pakistan stocks have rallied after former cricketer Imran Khan was removed as Prime Minister, raising hopes that the election of Shehbaz Sharif as the next Prime Minister would bring political stability to the country. The KSE-100 (Karachi Stock Exchange) jumped 3.4%, the most since November 2020. Furthermore, Pakistan's currency climbed to the highest level since March 30.

195.title: Hope we continue to make hits: B Praak on working with Harrdy in 'Kudiyan...'
195.article_body: Speaking about his experience of composing song 'Kudiyan Lahore Diyan' for singer Harrdy Sandhu and for his channel, singer B Praak said, "From 'Bijlee Bijlee' to 'Kudiyan Lahore Diyan', I think, fans are seeing Harrdy in an altogether different light. It was...fun composing and producing this one with him." "I...hope we continue to make hits like this," he added.

196.title: After break up with medical student, TN man steals laptops from college
196.article_body: A 25-year-old man has been arrested in Chennai for allegedly stealing laptops from medical college hostels to take revenge on his former girlfriend, a medical student, who broke up with him. The man has stolen 31 high-end laptops and has been making a living by selling them. He committed similar crimes in medical college hostels in Kerala, Delhi and Gujarat.

197.title: Who are the highest run-scorers in IPL 2022 after 20 matches?
197.article_body: Following the conclusion of the first 20 matches of IPL 2022, RR's Jos Buttler leads the list of highest run-getters with 218 runs from four innings. Buttler is the only batter to have scored a hundred in IPL 2022 so far. He is followed by LSG's Quinton De Kock (188 runs), GT's Shubman Gill (180) and MI's Ishan Kishan (175).

198.title: 10-yr-old activist Licypriya cleans waste on public ground after festival in Manipur
198.article_body: Manipur's 10-year-old environmental activist Licypriya Kangujam cleaned a public ground littered with plastic waste and bottles after the 'Yaoshang' festival celebrations in her village. The climate activist took to Twitter to share pictures of the ground before and after the collection of waste. "Yaoshang is over, but the battle against plastic waste isn't over," she told The Sangai Express.

199.title: 'The Kashmir Files' producers reunite for two more films
199.article_body: Following the success of 'The Kashmir Files', Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri, Pallavi Joshi and Abhishek Agarwal are coming together again to produce two more films. According to a video shared by Vivek, the films will show 'two brutally honest stories' from Indian history which will have 'spine-chilling truths'. 'The Kashmir Files' has earned â¹250.73 crore in India so far.

200.title: 2,200 men trying to leave Ukraine in breach of martial law detained
200.article_body: Ukraine's border agency has said that it has so far detained about 2,200 men of fighting age, who were trying to leave the country amid the war with Russia. Under Ukraine's martial law, men aged between 18 to 60 are prohibited from leaving the country. The agency said that the men had used forged documents and tried to bribe officials.

201.title: Ericsson indefinitely suspends its business in Russia
201.article_body: Telecom equipment maker Ericsson on Monday said it's suspending its business in Russia indefinitely. "In the light of recent events and of European Union sanctions, the company will now suspend its affected business with customers in Russia indefinitely," the Swedish firm said in a statement. Ericsson would record a $95 million provision for impairment of assets and other exceptional costs.

202.title: Destroyed S-300 anti-aircraft missile systems in Ukraine: Russia
202.article_body: Russia on Monday claimed to have destroyed S-300 anti-aircraft missile systems that it said was given to Ukraine by a European country. Russia's defence ministry said that its forces launched Kalibr missiles to destroy four S-300 launchers concealed in a hangar near the Dnipro city. It further claimed that 25 Ukrainian soldiers were hit in the attack.

203.title: When in power, don't treat farmers unfairly: Telangana CM
203.article_body: Amid the ongoing paddy procurement issue in the state, Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao said, "Is growing paddy Telangana farmers' fault?" "I warn PM Modi that you can't mess with farmers. Indian history is a testament that wherever farmers cried, government loses power. Nobody is permanent...When in power, don't treat farmers unfairly," Rao added.

204.title: Pak crisis won't affect its relations with Afghanistan: Taliban
204.article_body: Taliban government's Deputy Spokesperson Inamullah Samangani has said that the political crisis in Pakistan won't have "any particular impact" on its relations with Afghanistan, TOLO News reported. This comes after Imran Khan was ousted as Pakistan PM after losing a no-trust vote. Samangani added that the government "seeks good economic and political relations between the two countries".

205.title: Aryan Khan begins work on his web show; does test shoot in Mumbai: Reports
205.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan has reportedly begun work on his untitled web show. According to reports, Aryan will not just write but also direct the show. He also did a test shoot for his show, last week in Mumbai, reports added. Aryan had reportedly taken complete charge at the test shoot that took place on Friday and Saturday.

206.title: Ishaan Khatter shares pics from 'Pippa' sets, announces wrap
206.article_body: Actor Ishaan Khatter on Monday took to Instagram to share a series of pictures from the sets of his upcoming film 'Pippa' and announced a wrap of the shooting. He wrote in the caption, "Filled with gratitude for the experience of this film...Humbled and brimming with love. This is your Captain Balram Singh Mehta signing off from #Pippa."

207.title: Our bowling has been our biggest positive this season: DC's Kuldeep Yadav
207.article_body: DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav, who has picked 10 wickets in four games so far, has said their bowling has been their "biggest positive" this IPL season. "When we were bowling against MI in our first game, it looked like they'll score 200, but we restricted them to 177/5," recalled Kuldeep. DC won by 44 runs against KKR after posting 215/5.

208.title: Hyderabad police arrest burglar, recover items worth â¹32 lakh
208.article_body: A team of Hyderabad's LB Nagar Police Station arrested a habitual burglar, Jaganath (28), who has committed multiple inter-state offences. The police recovered items worth â¹32 lakh from the accused. Some of the recovered items are a Ford Figo car, mobile phones and 440 grams of gold ornaments, police said. Notably, the accused is a resident of Karnataka's Tumkur district.

209.title: Kashmir Files becomes 1st Hindi film to cross â¹250-cr mark post-pandemic
209.article_body: Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files' has become the first Hindi film to cross the â¹250-crore mark at the domestic box office since the COVID-19 pandemic began. The film, which was reportedly made on a budget of â¹15 crore, has collected â¹250.73 crore in India. 'The Kashmir Files' stars Anupam Kher, Pallavi Joshi and Darshan Kumaar among others in key roles.

210.title: Salman revived my career with Race 3; lot of people started noticing me: Bobby
210.article_body: Bobby Deol said Salman Khan revived his career with 'Race 3'. "Salman gave me an opportunity in 'Race 3' and that was the beginning of...lot of things for me...People saw me after a long time," he added. "Because of Race 3, I landed a role in 'Housefull 3' and that's how the younger generation started noticing me," Bobby said.

211.title: He's a player with destructive batting: Rahul on Stoinis' 38* vs RR
211.article_body: Praising Marcus Stoinis for his "destructive batting" after he made his LSG debut against RR in IPL 2022, LSG captain KL Rahul said his teammate has lot of power and can win matches for them from any position. The all-rounder scored a 17-ball 38* in his side's three-run loss to RR on Sunday. LSG have three wins from five matches.

212.title: Cyber police busts job racket in Noida; 5 women among 10 arrested
212.article_body: The cyber police team has arrested 10 people, including five women, for running a fake call centre in Noida duping people on the pretext of providing them jobs. The gang, which had two main accused, cheated over 100 people in the last four months. The call centre was raided after a woman, who was cheated of â¹10,900, lodged a complaint.

213.title: ED questions Congress' Mallikarjun Kharge in National Herald case
213.article_body: Enforcement Directorate on Monday questioned Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge in connection with a money laundering probe linked to the National Herald case. BJP's Subramanian Swamy had in a Delhi court filed a complaint against Congress' Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi, their companies and associated persons. Leaders Motilal Vora and Oscar Fernandes were also named.

214.title: 4 Sri Ram Sena members held in K'taka for vandalising Muslim fruit vendor's shop
214.article_body: Karnataka Police on Monday arrested four members of Sri Ram Sena for allegedly vandalising a fruit shop owned by a Muslim vendor in the Dharwad district of Karnataka. Police have lodged an FIR against eight persons on charges of deliberately hurting religious sentiments, unlawful assembly, rioting, and deliberate attempt to breach of peace.

215.title: Which platform can ever pull this off?: Paytm CEO on Bezos-Musk Twitter exchange
215.article_body: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos supported Tesla CEO Elon Musk's idea of starting a homeless shelter at Twitter's San Francisco headquarters. Paytm Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma reacted to the exchange and said, "Jeff joins Elon on Twitter. Which platform in the world can ever pull this off?" Bezos said a portion of the headquarters can be converted.

216.title: Ranbir Kapoor to play a therapist in Luv Ranjan's film: Report
216.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor will play the role of a therapist in Luv Ranjan's upcoming film, according to a report. "He will be playing the role of a therapist who [specialises] in solving relationship problems of people," Bollywood Hungama said quoting a source. The yet-untitled film also stars Shraddha Kapoor, Dimple Kapadia and Boney Kapoor.

217.title: Won't attack Mariupol only, will take Kyiv too: Chechen chief
217.article_body: The leader of Russia's republic of Chechnya, Ramzan Kadyrov, has said that Russian forces will not just attack Ukraine's Mariupol, but also take the capital Kyiv. "There will be an offensive... not only on Mariupol," he said. "Luhansk and Donetsk - we will fully liberate in the first place... and then take Kyiv and all other cities," he added.

218.title: Austrian leader to meet Putin amid Ukraine crisis, says war 'must stop'
218.article_body: Austrian Chancellor Karl Nehammer has said that he will meet Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow on Monday. Nehammer added that while Austria is militarily neutral, it has a clear stance on Ukraine conflict which "must stop", adding need for humanitarian corridors. Notably, Nehammer's meeting would be the first in-person interaction between Putin and a European Union leader since invasion.

219.title: Pratik, Patralekhaa to star in Jyotirao Phule-Savitribai Phule's biopic
219.article_body: Actors Pratik Gandhi and Patralekhaa will essay the roles of social activists, Mahatma Jyotirao Govindrao Phule and his wife Savitribai Phule respectively in the biopic 'Phule'. On the 195th birth anniversary of Jyotiba Phule, the makers of 'Phule' revealed the first look of the film. Helmed by National Award-winning director Ananth Mahadevan, the film will have a worldwide release.

220.title: Rakesh Tikait joins TRS protest in Delhi on paddy procurement issue
220.article_body: BKU leader Rakesh Tikait on Monday joined the ongoing protest by TRS at the Telangana Bhavan in Delhi against the alleged "discriminatory policy" of procurement of foodgrains. Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao is leading the protest. "Our farmers are not getting the right price. We request the Central government to procure paddy from our state," TRS MLC K Kavitha said.

221.title: WhatsApp to show estimated time of arrival for file sharing: Report
221.article_body: A new WhatsApp feature will let users understand when a document is fully downloaded on their devices or uploaded to their servers, WABetaInfo reported. On uploading a document, a new label showing the estimated time of arrival appears in the chat bubble, under the document name. The feature has been released on WhatsApp beta for Android and iOS.

222.title: 1 killed, 25 injured as speeding car hits bus, making it skid on its side in Pune
222.article_body: A driver of a Swift car was killed and 25 passengers of a bus were injured when the car rammed into the bus coming from the opposite direction on the Pune-Ahmednagar highway, police said. The bus turned and skidded on its side before crashing into parked vehicles due to the collision. The accident was partially captured in a CCTV camera.

223.title: 3 of same family die by suicide in Kerala's Kochi over mounting debt
223.article_body: Three members of the same family allegedly died by suicide in Kerala's Kochi due to mounting debt, police said. The deceased's bodies were found by children in the family when they woke up on Monday morning, following which they alerted their neighbours about the incident. According to police, the family operated a flour mill and had allegedly incurred heavy losses.

224.title: Jada Pinkett Smith makes first appearance since Will Smith's Oscar slap
224.article_body: Actress Jada Pinkett Smith made her first public appearance on Saturday since her husband Will Smith slapped Chris Rock at the Oscars. She attended the opening of the Rhimes Performing Arts Center in Los Angeles and posed alongside television producer Shonda Rhimes and actress Debbie Allen. Jada also shared a picture of posing on the red carpet with the two.

225.title: No need to panic about the new XE coronavirus variant: NTAGI chief
225.article_body: National Technical Advisory Group on Immunisation (NTAGI) chief Dr NK Arora on Monday said there is no need to panic about the new XE variant of coronavirus. Omicron variants of the X series are not causing serious diseases and do not show a very rapid spread, Dr Arora said. "These variants will keep on occurring," he added.

226.title: Gurugram society residents protest 2 months after ceiling collapse
226.article_body: A group of apartment owners of Gurugram's Chintels Paradiso held silent protests on Sunday at various government offices two months after collapse of multiple ceilings in a building in the residential society. The group said they wanted to highlight the fact that little to no progress had been made regarding the CBI probe, structural audit and compensation to buyers.

227.title: Kanye looking for 'behavioural treatment' at luxury facility: Report
227.article_body: Kanye West is looking for "behavioural treatment" to "be a better human and better dad" for his four kids with ex-wife Kim Kardashian, reported Page Six. As per the report, he is "going away to get help" and his team is looking for places with a luxury component. This comes after Kanye's online harassment of Kim and boyfriend Pete Davidson.

228.title: Over 15,000 have signed up for govtâs yoga programme: Delhi govt
228.article_body: The Delhi government's 'Dilli Ki Yogshala', an initiative to provide free yoga training on demand in neighbourhoods, has seen over 15,000 enrolments since its launch in December last year, an official said. Around 9,500 people are getting trained in yoga every day and Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal announced in January that it would be available online for COVID-19 patients.

229.title: NITI Aayog ranks states on energy efficiency, Gujarat tops among larger states
229.article_body: NITI Aayog has released rankings for the State Energy and Climate Index (SECI) Round 1 and Gujarat has ranked first among larger states. It was followed by Kerala and Punjab, while Chhattisgarh, Madhya Pradesh and Jharkhand were placed at the bottom. Among smaller states, Goa topped the index which ranks states on energy efficiency, sustainability and four other parameters.

230.title: 40 e-scooters of Jitendra EV catch fire in a truck in Nashik, no casualties reported
230.article_body: As many as 40 electric scooters of Jitendra Electric Vehicles (Jitendra EV) caught fire on Monday after being loaded in a transport container in Nashik. The company said that the incident took place near its factory and no casualties have been reported. Jitendra EV is conducting an investigation to find the root cause of the fire.

231.title: Lost a lot of weight while shooting for Ali's action film: Shahid
231.article_body: Shahid Kapoor, speaking about his upcoming action film with director Ali Abbas Zafar, said it's a departure from the "typical" action movies. "It's a kind of action...I've not done before...It's an edgy action, it has...quirk to it," he added. Shahid further said doing action is very tiring, adding that he lost a lot of weight while shooting for the film.

232.title: Delhi's Museum of Prime Ministers to be inaugurated on Thursday
232.article_body: The Pradhan Mantri Sangrahalaya, or the Museum of Prime Ministers, is all set to be inaugurated on Thursday at the Teen Murti complex in New Delhi. The space recognises contributions of all 14 former PMs irrespective of ideology or tenure, officials of the Ministry of Culture said. The museum houses some personal items, gifts and memorabilia related to the PMs.

233.title: TN Assembly passes resolution against CUET, BJP walks out
233.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Assembly adopted a resolution urging the Centre to withdraw the proposal to conduct Common University Entrance Test (CUET) for admission in central varsities. The resolution was supported by all the parties including the main opposition AIADMK. However, BJP staged a walkout. The resolution claimed that CUET "will sideline the diverse school education systems across the country".

234.title: Maha BJP chief asks Congress to prove its Hindutva credentials
234.article_body: MaharashtraÂ BJPÂ chief Chandrakant Patil asked Congress to prove its Hindutva credentials by announcing that it welcomes the abrogation of Article 370. He was addressing a press conference after campaigning for BJP candidate for Kolhapur North Assembly bypoll. "If they want to preserve Hindutva in Kolhapur, then Congress should announce that it welcomes the removal of Article 370," Patil said.

235.title: Violence won't be tolerated: JNU as students clash over non-veg food
235.article_body: JNU on Monday said no violence will be tolerated on the campus, a day after some students were injured in a clash between two groups allegedly over serving chicken for dinner on Ram Navami. JNU urged students to maintain peace. An FIR was registered on a complaint filed by members of JNUSU, SFI, DSF and AISA against unknown ABVP students.

236.title: Whatever the result is, we're going to protect our environment: MI's Zaheer
236.article_body: MI's Director of Cricket Zaheer Khan has said whatever the result is this IPL season, they're going to protect their team environment. "You've got to be able to close those moments of the game where the momentum is shifting. We have...not been able to do that," he added. So far, MI are winless in their four games this season.

237.title: Teen dies after gangrape at TMC leader's son's party in WB; 'forcibly cremated'
237.article_body: A teenage girl died after being allegedly gang-raped at the birthday party of the son of a TMC panchayat member in West Bengal's Nadia. The girl's mother alleged that a group of people forcibly took her body for cremation before her death certificate was issued. Police, however, said the family cremated her. The TMC leader's son has been arrested.

238.title: Aishwarya orders room service for me, else I don't eat: Abhishek Bachchan
238.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan in an interview has revealed that he has certain quirks including having a problem speaking to strangers on the phone. He added that during outdoor shoots, he can't call room service and his wife actress Aishwarya Rai calls room service to order food for him. "Otherwise she knows I won't eat. I have this issue," Abhishek said.

239.title: Amid rising fuel costs, Hyd techie designs 7-seater 'pedal car'
239.article_body: Amid rising fuel costs, a Hyderabad-based techie, Pranav Upadhyay, has designed community 'pedal car' for intracity commutes. The vehicle can accommodate seven people, five of whom can pedal car, while two seats are designed for differently-abled people. Upadhyay said that he seeks to combat air pollution through this initiative, adding that he'll design a more sustainable version of car soon.

240.title: 1 killed, 25 injured as car hits passenger bus on Pune-Ahmednagar highway
240.article_body: One person was killed and at least 25 others were injured after a speeding vehicle hit a passenger bus coming from the opposite side on the Pune-Ahmednagar highway late Sunday night. After the accident, the bus skidded off the road and hit three vehicles parked in front of a hotel. The car driver died on the spot.

241.title: I want to turn Prithvi Shaw into a player who plays over 100 Tests: Ponting
241.article_body: DC head coach Ricky Ponting has said their opener Prithvi Shaw has as much talent as he had if not more and he wants to turn the 22-year-old into a player who plays over 100 Tests. In their four matches in IPL 2022, Prithvi has scored 38, 10, 61 and 51 runs. Last season, Prithvi had scored 479 runs.

242.title: Farhan shares BTS clips from Rishi Kapoor's last film 'Sharmaji Namkeen'
242.article_body: Director-Actor Farhan Akhtar shared behind-the-scenes (BTS) clips from late actor Rishi Kapoor's last film 'Sharmaji Namkeen'. Alongside the post, he wrote, "Best moments served with love from the sets of #SharmajiNamkeen." Commenting on the post, actor Ronit Roy wrote, "Much senior to me but [he was] one of the best friends I had in the industry. I miss him."

243.title: UP govt's Twitter handle gets hacked, tweets on NFT trading posted
243.article_body: The official Twitter account of the Uttar Pradesh government was hacked on Monday morning, two days after UP CM Yogi Adityanath's Twitter handle was also hacked. The tweets posted by the hackers were related to cryptocurrencies and NFTs and were deleted after the account was restored. They also tagged a number of random accounts in subsequent tweets.

244.title: Punjab Congress' Twitter account gets hacked, location changed to 'Metaverse'
244.article_body: Punjab Congress' official Twitter account was hacked on Monday as their timeline was spammed with random users being tagged. The location of the account was also changed from 'Chandigarh' to 'Metaverse'. Recently, some of the prominent Twitter accounts including the Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister's Office and the University Grants Commission were hacked for a while by the miscreants.

245.title: Pic shows RK Studios decked up with lights ahead of Ranbir-Alia's reported wedding
245.article_body: A picture has surfaced online showing RK Studios in Chembur being decked up with lights ahead of Ranbir Kapoor-Alia Bhatt's reported wedding. On Sunday, visuals of Ranbir Kapoorâs under-construction house in Bandra surfaced online, showing the building being decorated with LED string lights. Alia's half brother Rahul Bhatt had earlier confirmed that the wedding is happening.

246.title: Jeff Bezos responds to Musk's poll to turn Twitter HQ into a homeless shelter
246.article_body: Jeff Bezos, Amazon Founder and the world's second-richest person, responded to a poll by the world's richest man, Elon Musk, on whether Twitter's San Francisco headquarters should be converted into a homeless shelter. "Or do portion. Worked out great and makes it easy for employees who want to volunteer," Bezos tweeted to Musk. Elon Musk responded "Great idea" to Bezos.

247.title: Rape destroys soul: Court on Mumbai attempted gang-rape case
247.article_body: A special POCSO court sentenced a 28-year-old man to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment for attempting to gang-rape a 15-year-old mentally challenged girl in Mumbai. The court observed that rape is "more heinous" than murder as it "destroys the soul" of the woman. The girl had reportedly told her mother that the accused had tried to lure her with â¹10.

248.title: Let's tune out noise, stay focused: Twitter CEO as Musk turns down board seat
248.article_body: After Elon Musk turned down the offer to join Twitter's board of directors, the company's CEO Parag Agrawal told his team, "Let's tune out the noise and stay focused on the work." He added, "There will be distractions ahead but our goals and priorities remain unchanged." Musk's appointment was "contingent on a background check and formal acceptance", Agrawal said.

249.title: She has been trolled & mocked: Neha on why she chose Rashami for her song Parwah
249.article_body: Speaking about her song 'Parwah', which also stars actress Rashami Desai, singer and ex-Bigg Boss OTT contestant, Neha Bhasin said, "I wrote the song after 'Bigg Boss OTT'. I was angry at that time...It started from...being misunderstood." "Then I met Rashami and thought, why not feature her because...sheâs also been trolled a lot and mocked by the world," Neha added.

250.title: Ghaziabad school shut after 2 students test COVID-19 positive
250.article_body: A private school in UP's Ghaziabad was closed for three days after two students tested positive for COVID-19. In a letter to parents, the Principal said that the school management has decided to suspend offline classes from April 11 to 13 in order to break the infection chain. "We will continue imparting education through online classes," added the Principal.

251.title: 9 arrested over clashes in Guj's Khambat; Section 144 imposed in Himmatnagar
251.article_body: Police have arrested nine persons for their alleged involvement in communal violence and stone-pelting incidents during a Ram Navami procession in Khambhat city of Gujarat's Anand district, officials said. Additionally, Section 144 of the CrPC has been imposed in Sabarkantha district's Himmatnagar, where communal clashes were also reported. The prohibitory order will remain in force till April 13.

252.title: CPI MP urges PM to provide free COVID-19 vaccine booster doses
252.article_body: CPI MP Binoy Viswam has written a letter to PM Narendra Modi urging him to provide COVID-19 vaccine booster doses for free at public healthcare institutions. Criticising Centre's move to allow only private vaccination centres to administer paid booster shots to adults above 18 years, Viswam said that the privatisation of the vaccination drive is ill-planned and disastrous.

253.title: Apple starts making iPhone 13 in India
253.article_body: Apple confirmed that the company's manufacturing partner Foxconn has started assembling the iPhone 13 at its plant near Chennai. Foxconn also makes the iPhone 12 and iPhone 11 in India. "We are excited to begin making iPhone 13...right here in India for our local customers," Apple said.

254.title: Groom among 3 injured in celebratory firing in Raj; shooter accidentally kills self
254.article_body: A man, named in 13 criminal cases, injured three persons in celebratory firing, before accidentally shooting himself with his country-made pistol at a wedding function in Rajasthan's Sikar district, according to police. The groom, who sustained injuries, is also a criminal and is named in several cases. Five persons have been taken into custody for questioning, police added.

255.title: Actress Pranitha Subhash announces pregnancy, shares pics of ultrasound
255.article_body: Actress Pranitha Subhash took to Instagram to announce that she's expecting her first child with her husband Nithin Raju, who's a Bengaluru-based businessman. Pranitha, who appears in Kannada, Tamil, Telugu and Hindi movies, shared pictures of ultrasound with her over five million followers on Instagram. She wrote, "For my husband's 34th bday, the angels above have a present for us."

256.title: 16 women die after delivery every month in Delhi's 4 major govt hospitals: RTI
256.article_body: Around 16 women die after childbirth every month in four major government hospitals in Delhi, as per information released by hospitals under the Right to Information (RTI) Act. According to the information received, 1,281 women died after childbirth between January 2015 and September 2021 at AIIMS Delhi, Ram Manohar Lohia Hospital (RML), Safdarjung Hospital and Sucheta Kriplani Hospital

257.title: Names of 6 aides of ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan added to 'stop list': Report
257.article_body: The names of six key aides of ousted Pakistan PM Imran Khan have been put on the 'stop list' by the FIA to prevent them from leaving the country, reports said. Khan's former principal secretary Azam Khan, ex-special assistant on political communication Shahbaz Gill and ex-adviser on interior and accountability Shahzad Akbar were reportedly added to the list.

258.title: Harshest action against Khargone rioters; will make them pay for damages: MP CM
258.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Monday termed the clashes in Khargone as "unfortunate" and said the harshest action will be taken against rioters, who have been identified. "Action doesn't mean only sending the offenders to jail. They'll be made to pay for the damage to public and private property," he added. "We're forming a 'Claims Tribunal'," Chouhan said.

259.title: Thar is Harsh Varrdhan's first film as producer; he's passionate about it: Anil
259.article_body: Speaking about his son Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor's first film as a producer, Anil Kapoor said Harsh Varrdhan has a unique approach and his choices of films are distinct. "[He's]...passionate about the project and he played an integral part in this film coming together," Anil added. "'Thar' is an experience and I can't wait for audiences to watch it!" Anil said.

260.title: Tiger found dead in Madhya Pradesh, 5th death in fortnight
260.article_body: A tiger was found dead at Pench Tiger Reserve (PTR) in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni district on Sunday. Officials suspect that the tiger, which was around two years old, was killed by another feline during a territorial fight. Five tigers have died so far since March 29 in Madhya Pradesh which reportedly has the highest number of tigers among all states.

261.title: Drunk man falls asleep in car in middle of Mumbai road causing traffic jam, held
261.article_body: A 34-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly stopping his car in the middle of a road in Mumbai's Borivali West and falling asleep in the vehicle, causing a traffic jam, police said. A police officer went up to the driver, woke him up and questioned him about his errant behaviour. Police added that the man was reeking of alcohol.

262.title: Never expected to get both Chahal, Ashwin in auction: RR's Sangakkara
262.article_body: RR's Director of Cricket Kumar Sangakkara has said they never expected to get both Yuzvendra Chahal and Ravichandran Ashwin in the auction. "I think they're the best two spinners going around so far...we're lucky and fortunate to have them and all we're trying to do is support them to get better," he added. Chahal picked four wickets against LSG.

263.title: Ded: Alia Bhatt on YouTuber recreating 'Kabir Singh' scene over reports of her wedding
263.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt took to Instagram to react to YouTuber Be YouNick recreating a scene from 'Kabir Singh' with reference to Alia's wedding with Ranbir Kapoor. In the video, the YouTuber can be seen running behind a car which had a placard behind it reading "Alia weds Ranbir." "Ded," Alia wrote commenting on the video.

264.title: I'm a firm believer in God; I go to church, temple, dargah: Vijay
264.article_body: Actor Vijay, during a recent interview, said that he respects all religions. "I'm a firm believer. I go to church, I've gone to temples and Ameen Peer Dargah during the filming of Thuppakki," he said, adding, "My mother is...Hindu and my father is Christian...I grew up in...household that never restricted me as to where I should go or shouldn't go."

265.title: Shahid's 'Jersey' postponed, film avoids clash with 'K.G.F: Chapter 2'
265.article_body: Shahid Kapoor-starrer 'Jersey', which was scheduled to release on April 14, has been postponed by a week. The Gowtam Tinnanuri directorial will now release in theatres on April 22, producer Aman Gill said. The sports drama has avoided the box office clash with Yash and Sanjay Dutt-starrer 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' and Vijay's action-thriller movie 'Beast'.

266.title: Prithvi took on the bowlers, we were clueless at that point: Shreyas
266.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer has said that they were "clueless" when DC opener Prithvi Shaw took on the bowlers during their match on Sunday, which they lost by 44 runs. "Prithvi can change the game in the powerplay...he hits good shots and...I [couldn't] figure out how to set the field for him," added Shreyas. Prithvi scored 51(29) in the game.

267.title: Man flashes, makes obscene gestures at girl in Pune; booked
267.article_body: A man has been booked for allegedly flashing and making obscene gestures at a girl who was on her way to attend a class on Pune's Tilak road. The incident had occurred in January, but the girl filed a complaint on Sunday as she was apparently in a state of shock. The accused had also reportedly stalked the girl.

268.title: 27-year-old man abused, extorted after contacting 'escort service' in Mumbai
268.article_body: A 27-year-old man was allegedly abused and extorted after he contacted an escort service to enquire about the rates for massages in Mumbai. The complainant was also threatened by the unidentified accused that a photo of the former's wife will be uploaded on an adult website, police said. The complainant alleged that â¹1,000 was extorted from him by the accused.

269.title: Man rapes sister's 15-yr-old friend in B'luru; shares video with friends
269.article_body: A 20-year-old man and his five friends, including two minors, have been arrested on charges of allegedly raping and sexually abusing his sister's 15-year-old female friend in Bengaluru. The man had reportedly recorded a video of raping the girl and shared it with the others. The man's friends had apparently then used it to sexually harass and extort the girl.

270.title: N Korea celebrates 10 years of 'gifted thinker' Kim Jong Un's rule
270.article_body: North Korea celebrated 10 years of its ruler Kim Jong Un's leadership on Monday. The government praised his political achievements and unveiled new portraits and exhibitions on the occasion. A senior official called Kim "a gifted thinker and theoretician, outstanding statesman and peerlessly great commander" and praised him for making the country "a full-fledged military power".

271.title: Ded: Alia Bhatt on YouTuber recreating 'Kabir Singh' scene over reports of her wedding
271.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt took to Instagram to react to YouTuber Be YouNick recreating a scene from 'Kabir Singh' with reference to Alia's wedding with Ranbir Singh. In the video, the YouTuber can be seen running behind a car which had a placard behind it reading "Alia weds Ranbir." "Ded," Alia wrote commenting on the video.

272.title: 2 killed, 10 wounded in nightclub shooting in US' Iowa
272.article_body: A shooting inside a nightclub left a man and a woman dead and 10 people wounded in US' Iowa on Sunday, authorities said. Cedar Rapids Police Chief Wayne Jerman said investigators believe two men fired more than a dozen shots inside Taboo Nightclub and Lounge just before 1:30 am Sunday. Police are searching for suspects and no arrests were reported.

273.title: 2 dead, 48 stuck midair for 16 hrs after J'khand's ropeway cable car collision
273.article_body: At least two people died and several sustained injuries after some cable cars in a ropeway collided with each other due to a technical snag at Trikut Pahar in Jharkhand's Deoghar on Sunday. According to officials, 48 people are still stuck in at least 12 cabins. Teams of Indian Air Force (IAF) and NDRF have been deployed for rescue operation.

274.title: David Beckham's son Brooklyn, actress Nicola Peltz share pics from their wedding
274.article_body: Former England football team captain David Beckham's eldest son Brooklyn Beckham and actress Nicola Peltz took to Instagram to share pictures from their wedding. The couple got married in Palm Beach in US' Florida last weekend. "This was amazing to experience...you guys are beautiful," singer Lloyiso commented on one of the pictures.

275.title: Shanghai to lift lockdown in some areas despite COVID-19 surge
275.article_body: Even as over 25,000 new COVID-19 cases were recorded in China's Shanghai on Sunday, the authorities have decided to lift the lockdown in some areas. According to an official, the city has been classified into three risk categories. He said that as many as 7,565 "prevention areas" will be reopened after two weeks without a positive case.

276.title: Anushka to shoot for 'Chakda 'Xpress' at Lord's Cricket Ground: Report
276.article_body: Anushka Sharma will reportedly shoot for 'Chakda 'Xpress' at the Lord's Cricket Ground in London.  The actress, who'll portray cricketer Jhulan Goswami in the upcoming biopic, is also expected to shoot at Headingley Stadium, the report stated. "Anushka is expected to shoot at...a few other big...stadiums. It looks like...she'll travel to at least four big stadiums," a source told Pinkvilla.

277.title: 40-yr-old woman held for misbehaving with police in Chandigarh
277.article_body: A 40-year-old woman was arrested for misbehaving with police officers at Manimajra Police Station, Chandigarh. The accused and her father allegedly abused an officer and recorded their interaction with the family. Police officers said the station has CCTV cameras and asked her to stop recording, following which she misbehaved with one of the woman Assistant Sub-Inspectors and injured her.

278.title: 10 students in auto-rickshaw injured after being hit by truck in Pune
278.article_body: At least 10 school children and a driver of an auto-rickshaw were injured after being hit by a mini-truck while they were on their way to their school in Pune's Uruli Kanchan area. According to the police, the injured students are aged between seven to 12 years and only a few of them including the driver have sustained serious injuries.

279.title: Kuldeep executed it well vs Stoinis and he's only going to get better: Boult
279.article_body: RR pacer Trent Boult praised his fellow pacer Kuldeep Sen for defending 15 runs in the final over against LSG, stating that the 25-year-old is only going to get better in the upcoming games. "Kuldeep executed it well [against Marcus Stoinis]," stated Boult. With Marcus Stoinis on strike, Kuldeep bowled three dot balls and conceded only 11 in final over.

280.title: Nadabet project will give employment to 5 lakh youth in 10 years: Amit Shah
280.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, who inaugurated the border viewing point on the India-Pakistan international border in Gujarat's Nadabet, said the pilot project will provide employment to over five lakh youth in next 10 years. "I pay my homage to PM Narendra Modi's vision for he had come up with the idea of a multidimensional project for Nadabet," Shah added.

281.title: Hong Kong Customs seizes record methamphetamine haul worth â¹387 cr
281.article_body: Hong Kong Customs said on Sunday that it has seized a record haul of methamphetamine worth HK$400 million (approximately â¹387 cr) and arrested two men in the matter. About 447 kg of the suspected drug was hidden in three transformers, while the rest was found at a logistics warehouse in 10 pieces of industrial-use anti-vibratory rubber, it added.

282.title: Big B reunites with co-star Nafisa Ali for Uunchai; fan says 'Beautiful jodi'
282.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan reunited with his 'Major Saab' co-star Nafisa Ali Sodhi for his upcoming project 'Uunchai'. The two played a married couple in the 1998 film which also starred Ajay Devgn. Sharing pictures with Amitabh, Nafisa wrote, "My...handsome, amazing man...and adorable co-star Amitabh Bachchan." She also shared a throwback picture of them from 'Major Saab', and wrote, "How time flies."

283.title: Unfortunate that people in power promoted 'The Kashmir Files': Pawar
283.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said it is "unfortunate" that people in power promoted 'The Kashmir Files' movie. "An individual made a movie (The Kashmir Files) showing atrocities on Hindus," Pawar added. "It depicted that in Kashmir, the Hindu Pandits were minorities and they were driven out during VP Singh-led government which was supported byÂ BJP," Pawar stated.

284.title: Mysterious creature with human-like lips washes up on Australian beach, pic surfaces
284.article_body: A mysterious creature with human-like lips washed up on Bondi Beach in Australia. A jogger posted a video on Facebook of the creature and asked people to help him identify it. The jogger said that the animal appeared to be nearly half a metre long and had lips like a human and skin like a shark.

285.title: Musk tweets emoji with hand on mouth after Twitter CEO says he won't join Board
285.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk shared a laughing emoji with hand on mouth on Twitter about an hour after Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal announced that Musk has decided not to join its Board. Musk, who is Twitter's biggest shareholder, later deleted the tweet. Agrawal said that Twitter will value input from its shareholders, whether or not they are on the Board.

286.title: 1 killed, another injured in Gujarat during clashes amid Ram Navami procession
286.article_body: One person died and another sustained injuries after communal clashes broke out in Gujarat's Khambhat during a Ram Navami procession on Sunday. "The body of an unidentified man, who appears to be aged around 65 years, was recovered from the spot...where two groups pelted stones at each other," an officer said. A few shop cabins were also set on fire.

287.title: 29-yr-old man dies after being hit by BEST bus in Mumbai, driver held
287.article_body: An employee at an IT company was killed after allegedly being hit by a BEST bus in Mumbai's Mankhurd area. The driver was arrested but was later granted bail by a magistrate court, police said. The deceased Karan Dumbre (29) was going to his home on his motorcycle when the accident took place, officials from the Trombay Police Station said.

288.title: Bank manager among 4 held for stealing valuables worth â¹2.5 cr from lockers in UP
288.article_body: Four persons, including a bank manager, were arrested in connection with an alleged theft of valuables worth over â¹2.5 crore from the lockers of the Central Bank of India's Karachi Khana branch in Kanpur, police said on Sunday. Stolen ornaments weighing 342 grams have been recovered from the accused, Deputy Commissioner of Police (East), Pramod Kumar, said.

289.title: Wanted Sarfaraz for the end, that's why we sent Axar, Shardul over him: Pant
289.article_body: On being asked why Sarfaraz Khan wasn't sent in to bat after the fall of the fifth wicket against KKR, DC captain Rishabh Pant said they wanted the 24-year-old for the end of the innings. "We wanted momentum to keep going...we knew [even] if we lost wickets...we'd have Sarfaraz...and that's why we sent Axar and Shardul over him," explained Pant.

290.title: Ram Navami processions attacked in Howrah, Bankura: WB leaders
290.article_body: West Bengal Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari on Sunday alleged that a Ram Navami procession was attacked by police in Howrah, saying, "Can't Sanatani devotees practice their religion in this state safely?" In another incident, Union Minister and state Lok Sabha MP Subhas Sarkar also claimed that a Ram Navami procession and his car were pelted with stones in Bankura.

291.title: Sec 144 imposed in village in J'khand's Lohardaga after communal violence
291.article_body: Communal clashes were reported in at least two districts of Jharkhand during Ram Navami processions on Sunday evening. In view of incidents of stone-pelting and arson, Section 144 of the CrPC has been imposed in Hirdi village of Lohardaga district, Sub-Divisional Magistrate (SDM) Arbind Kumar Lal said. Another instance of communal violence was reported in Bermo area of Bokaro district.

292.title: Queen Elizabeth II chats with COVID patients, staff at UK hospital
292.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II paid a virtual visit to a hospital in London and interacted with COVID-19 patients, doctors and nurses. The event marked the official opening of the Queen Elizabeth Unit, a critical care facility housing 155 beds. "It [COVID-19] does leave one very tired and exhausted, doesn't it?" the Queen told a couple recovering from the infection.

293.title: I once took up the role of Sita in Ramlila: Ravi Kishan
293.article_body: Actor-politician Ravi Kishan has said that he struggled for many years and played a lot of roles before achieving some level of success. He added that he even took up the role of Sita in Ramlila "for the sake of pursuing [his] passion for acting". Ravi further said his father didn't support him initially but his mother always supported him.

294.title: A RRRemarkable milestone: Ajay as 'RRR' crosses â¹1,000-cr mark globally
294.article_body: After 'RRR' crossed the â¹1,000-crore mark at the global box office, Ajay Devgn took to Twitter to congratulate the team of the action-drama film. "A RRRemarkable Milestone! Congratulations to the entire team of #RRR for a record-breaking run at box office," Ajay, who played a character named Venkata Rama Raju in the film, wrote. 'RRR' was released on March 25.

295.title: Lakhs of people come out in streets in support of Imran Khan in Pakistan
295.article_body: Lakhs of people across Pakistan came out in streets in support of ousted PM Imran Khan on Sunday. Khan tweeted a video from Lahore and wrote, "Never have such crowds come out so spontaneously and in such numbers in our history, rejecting the imported govt led by crooks." Protests also took place in Karachi, Peshawar, Islamabad, Rawalpindi and Abbottabad.

296.title: Macron to face Marine Le Pen in presidential election in France
296.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron is set to face candidate Marine Le Pen in the presidential election runoff scheduled to be held on April 24. They emerged as the top two candidates after the first round of voting for the presidential election. Notably, Le Pen has called for banning hijab in public and halal butchers.

297.title: Earlier did some films to make my husband happy; I was like a chamchi: Neetu
297.article_body: Neetu Kapoor revealed earlier she did some films because of her husband, late actor Rishi Kapoor. She said, "There were films that I did with my husband and I was like a chamchi, he'd say 'come and do it'. I wouldn't do it on my own will." "I was doing (all that) trying to make my husband happy," she added.

298.title: War wouldn't have happened if Ukraine was in NATO: Ukraine minister
298.article_body: Ukraine Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba during an interview with NBC News said that the war with Russia wouldn't have taken place if the former country was "a member of NATO". He added that the "strategic mistake" by Germany and France in 2008, when they rejected US and its allies' efforts on the same, is "something that Ukraine is paying for".

299.title: Gujarat's education system is crumbling, says Arvind Kejriwal
299.article_body: AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal said that the people in Gujarat have begun to question the "crumbling education" system in the state being ruled by BJP for the last 27 years. Kejriwal promised that his party will provide just as "good education" to the students there as it is available in Delhi if voted to power in the upcoming polls.

300.title: Opposition is weak, BJP hammering it through probe agencies: Raut
300.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has accused the BJP-led Centre of "hammering the opposition through central investigative agencies" which already is "weak". "Despite this, the opposition is not ready to surrender," Raut said. "The weak opposition is being hammered...and our HM (Amit) Shah says, they want to see a strong opposition! This joke is interesting," added Raut.

301.title: Muslims offer water bottles in Ram Navami procession in Siliguri
301.article_body: Muslim youths in West Bengal's Siliguri offered water bottles and hugged participants of a Ram Navami procession on Sunday. One of the Muslim volunteers said that they had done so to "foster affection among the people of different communities". "It is a nice gesture that they came forward to greet us on the occasion," a participant of the procession said.

302.title: 6 workers killed as blast at chemical factory triggers fire in Gujarat's Bharuch
302.article_body: Six workers were killed after a blast at a chemical factory in Gujarat's Bharuch district triggered a fire on Monday early morning. Bharuch SP Leena Patil said the victims were working near a reactor, which suddenly exploded during solvent distillation process. "The victims' bodies were later recovered and sent for postmortem. The fire was also brought under control," she added.

303.title: India reports 861 new COVID-19 cases, 6 deaths in 24 hours
303.article_body: India has reported 861 new COVID-19 cases, 929 recoveries and six more deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country reported 1,054 COVID-19 cases and 29 deaths. India's active caseload currently stands at 11,058, while the death toll reached 5,21,691.

304.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read after 20 matches?
304.article_body: After the first 20 matches of IPL 2022, RR, KKR, GT, RCB and LSG have accumulated six points each. RR are on top of the table due to a superior net run-rate. GT are the only unbeaten team in the tournament so far, while defending champions CSK and five-time champions MI are yet to win a match.

305.title: 2 arrested for selling adulterated ghee in Delhi
305.article_body: The Delhi Police have arrested two people for allegedly selling adulterated ghee. The police said they recovered over 1,200 litres of adulterated ghee in packages of different brands. The matter came to light when a ghee manufacturing firm complained that some people were tampering with packets of the company's original product and adding fake ghee to them.

306.title: Shreyas Iyer's wicket was very important for me: Kuldeep on 4/35 vs KKR
306.article_body: DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav, who picked four wickets against KKR during their match on Sunday, has said KKR captain Shreyas Iyer's wicket was "personally very important" for him. "Shreyas was batting well and I wanted to make him guess. It was a very big wicket," he added. Apart from Shreyas, Kuldeep dismissed Pat Cummins, Sunil Narine and Umesh Yadav.

307.title: Fire destroys 200 acres of standing wheat crop in Haryana's Karnal
307.article_body: A fire on Sunday destroyed a standing wheat crop spread over 200 acres in Haryana's Karnal, with farmers claiming that the gutted crop and fodder were worth â¹1 crore. Five fire tenders were rushed to the spot and took several hours to put out the blaze. The fire had allegedly broken out due to a spark in the reaper machine.

308.title: IMD predicts relief from heatwave conditions over northwest India from April 12
308.article_body: The IMD has predicted some respite from the ongoing heatwave conditions over northwest India from Tuesday. IMD attributes this to an approaching fresh western disturbance, which will affect the western Himalayan regions from the night of April 12 and bring cooler winds over the heated regions. The maximum temperatures are likely to fall by 2-3Â°C over parts of northwest India.

309.title: Bihar govt official among 8 held for stealing 60-feet long iron bridge
309.article_body: Bihar Police arrested eight persons including a Sub Divisional Officer (SDO) of the Water Resources Department in connection with the theft of a 60-feet long abandoned bridge in Rohtas, an official said. According to the police, the thieves arrived with JCBs, pickup vans, gas cutters and vehicles and in three days they cut off the entire bridge and disappeared.

310.title: Actor Shiv Kumar Subramaniam passes away 2 months after 15-year-old son's demise
310.article_body: Actor-screenwriter Shiv Kumar Subramaniam, who featured in films like '2 States', 'Hichki' and 'Nail Polish', passed away two months after his 15-year-old son's demise. The cause of his death is not known yet. He had started his journey in film industry with writing the screenplay of Vidhu Vinod Chopra's 'Parinda' in 1989, for which he also won a Filmfare Award.

311.title: Elon Musk has decided not to join the Twitter board, says CEO Parag; shares note
311.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal has said that Elon Musk, who is Twitter's biggest shareholder, won't join the company's board. Parag shared a brief note he sent to the company, wherein he wrote, "Elon's appointment to the board was to become officially effective 4/9, but Elon shared that same morning that he will no longer be joining the board."

312.title: 10 injured as cable cars in Jharkhand ropeway collide, nearly 50 stuck midair
312.article_body: At least 10 tourists were injured, including two seriously, after some cable cars in a ropeway collided with each other at Trikut hills close to Baba Baidyanath Temple in Jharkhandâs Deoghar district on Sunday, officials said. As per eyewitnesses, 50 people are still stuck in at least 12 cabins in the ropeway and a rescue operation is underway, PTI reported.

313.title: We have this history, we're not getting really good starts: Shreyas Iyer
313.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer has said their top-order's form is something they need to work on in their upcoming games in IPL 2022. "We have this history...we [aren't] getting really good starts," he stated. Chasing 216 to win against DC, KKR were 43/2 after the powerplay and then lost by 44 runs. This was KKR's second defeat in five games.

314.title: Delhi Metro to bring in advanced scanners at stations in phases
314.article_body: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has said that it will install "highly advanced and state-of-the-art baggage scanners at stations in a phased manner". According to officials, 34 advanced scanners were installed under the first phase of the plan and about 250 more of them will be brought in across all metro stations by the end of 2022.

315.title: Students at Puneâs SPPU demand better food, hostel facilities
315.article_body: The students of Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) held protests demanding improvement in food quality in the canteens and expansion in hostel accommodations. According to students, the hostel admissions have not started with full capacity due to which they are forced to stay at costlier rented flats. A university official said the students' demands will be looked into.

316.title: Enjoyed De Kock's wicket the most: Chahal on picking 4 wickets vs LSG
316.article_body: RR spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, who was named Man of the Match for picking four wickets for 41 runs against LSG, has said he enjoyed taking Quinton de Kock's wicket the most in the game. "De Kock could've changed the game," he added. Chahal has now become the purple cap holder with 11 wickets in four games.

317.title: Curfew in 3 areas of MP's Khargone after stones hurled at Ram Navami procession
317.article_body: A curfew has been imposed in three areas, including Talab Chowk and Tavdi, of Madhya Pradesh's Khargone after stones were hurled at a Ram Navami procession on Sunday, which led to clashes and incidents of arson. Police fired tear gas shells to control the situation. Khargone District Collector said Section 144 of CrPC has been imposed in the entire city.

318.title: Imran Khan's niece Zayn gives an update on the actor, says 'He is happy'
318.article_body: Former actor Imran Khan's niece Zayn Khan shared an update on him. On Sunday, during an Ask Me Anything session on Instagram, a fan asked Zayn, "What's Imran Khan doing these days?" To which, Zayn replied, "He's being a father, he is being himself and...he's...happy and I think when people pull back asking for space, we should give them that."

319.title: Pune City Police conferred 'Best Police Unit' in Maharashtra award
319.article_body: Pune City Police tweeted on Sunday that it's been conferred the 'Best Police Unit' in Maharashtra award. The police also shared a picture of state Home Minister Dilip Walse-Patil handing over the award. "[We'll] strive to address all issues, big and small consistently and make Pune one of the safest cities anywhere in the world with your support," police said.

320.title: Man killed in scuffle over phone theft at Puneâs Ekvira pilgrimage
320.article_body: A 49-year-old man from Thane was killed and two of his friends were injured after they got into a fight with some street performers over the suspicion of phone theft at Pune's Ekvira pilgrimage. The deceased, Manoj Patil, was struck several times with bamboo sticks and stabbed in the chest. The police have arrested two of the suspects.

321.title: Sale, use and distribution of single-use plastic banned in Gurugram from July 1
321.article_body: The manufacturing, importing, stocking, distribution and sale of single-use plastic will be banned across Gurugram with effect from July 1. According to civic body officials, violation of the rule will attract a maximum fine of â¹25,000. Seven teams, each having five officials, have been constituted to monitor and enforce penalties for single-use plastic violations, a senior official said.

322.title: Kajol remembers dad on his death anniversary, shares old pic
322.article_body: Actress Kajol on Sunday shared a post on Instagram marking the 14th death anniversary of her filmmaker-father Shomu Mukherjee. She shared an old picture with her father, and wrote, "14 years ago today you left me. I feel it till today, miss you." Kajol's sister Tanishaa also shared a post on her Instagram Stories. "Miss you dad," she wrote.

323.title: We were 14/3, but we knew we had a chance: Rahul on 3-run defeat vs RR
323.article_body: After their 3-run defeat against RR, LSG captain KL Rahul said they have a team that's never out of the contest. "Even when we are [14/3], we knew we had a chance...Games like this will give us confidence and remind us that we are a good team," he added. Chasing RR's 165-run total, LSG could score 162/8 in 20 overs.

324.title: 1 lakh square feet of B'luru's Gattahalli lake encroached: Report
324.article_body: Local activists have claimed that over one lakh square feet of the Gattahalli lake in Bengaluru has been encroached by land sharks, the Indian Express reported. Last year, the revenue department had removed some encroachments, but locals said that the lake is "repeatedly encroached". "[The lake is] under danger due to rampant illegal constructions," Citizens Movement, East Bengaluru said.

325.title: Doctors remove tooth from lungs of 6-year-old boy in Mumbai after he couldn't breathe
325.article_body: Doctors from Wockhardt Hospitals in Mumbai removed a tooth from the right lung of a six-year-old boy after he accidentally swallowed it and wasn't able to breathe or eat. ENT consultant Dr Sangamlal Pal said the patient was shifted to paediatric ICU post-operation. The boy's father said he can breathe freely now and has got a fresh lease of life.

326.title: 100 capsules containing cocaine taken out of Kenyan national's body in Mumbai
326.article_body: A 23-year-old Kenyan national was arrested for allegedly smuggling cocaine worth â¹9 crore in Mumbai. Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) officials intercepted him at the international airport based on specific information and sent him for medical examination when nothing was found after they examined his baggage. At the hospital, 100 capsules containing cocaine were taken out of his body.

327.title: I felt Shahid was an arrogant man on sets of Kabir Singh: Jersey actor Geetika
327.article_body: Actress Geetika Mehandru, who worked with actor Shahid Kapoor in 'Kabir Singh' and 'Jersey' said that on the sets of 'Kabir Singh', she thought that Shahid was arrogant and moody. "But he is not. He just is in the character," she added. "Because of 'Jersey', I spent more time with him... [and] realised he's not somebody who's arrogant," Geetika said.

328.title: What does the law say about batters retiring during the innings?
328.article_body: RR's Ravichandran Ashwin became the first batter to be retired out in IPL history during their match against LSG. As per the law, a batter retires out if he retires without the umpire's permission and doesn't have the permission of the opposing captain to resume his innings. It is considered a dismissal for the purposes of calculating batting average.

329.title: Bangladesh's Mehidy Hasan gets hit on stomach after 'brain fade', video goes viral
329.article_body: On the second delivery of South Africa's second innings in the second Test, Bangladesh's Mehidy Hasan dropped a catch and was hit on the stomach after a "brain fade" moment. Mehidy didn't spot the ball after Sarel Erwee cut it towards the backward point. Mehidy was looking at his left and seemed to lose the ball under the lights.

330.title: Most successful people have a lot of skill and grit: Google's former CEO
330.article_body: Google's former CEO Eric Schmidt said the most successful people have a lot of skill and grit. "They're willing to put up with the setbacks and the inevitable challenges that people deal with in their...lives," the billionaire told CNBC. He added that he always wanted "a seat at the table", even if he didn't understand his ambition at the time.

331.title: RR end LSG's 3-match winning streak, jump to top of IPL 2022 points table
331.article_body: RR fast bowler Kuldeep Sen, playing in his first-ever IPL match, defended 15 runs in the last over to help his team defeat LSG by three runs. With this, RR ended LSG's three-match winning streak. RR have now jumped to the top of the IPL 2022 points table with three victories and a superior net run-rate of +0.951.

332.title: 14 unicorns created, $10.8 bn invested in startups in Q4 FY22: Report
332.article_body: As many as 14 startups attained the unicorn status in India in Q4 FY22 with the startup ecosystem attracting investment of $10.8 billion, a report by accounting firm PwC India said. With 334 funding deals in the quarter, India now has a total of 84 unicorns. With five unicorns, the software-as-a-service (SaaS) sector accounted for the largest sector-wise share.

333.title: Mexicans vote in first-ever referendum against President
333.article_body: Mexicans on Sunday began voting in a referendum on whether President AndrÃ©s Manuel LÃ³pez Obrador should end his term barely midway through or continue to the end. Obrador had himself pushed for the first so-called recall referendum in modern Mexico. Critics have claimed the referendum is a waste of money, which will cost the public exchequer almost $80 million.

334.title: Students clash in JNU over non-veg food, Ram Navami pooja; some injured
334.article_body: Some students in Delhi's JNU sustained injuries following a clash between members of ABVP and the Left-wing over the consumption of non-vegetarian food and the conduct of Ram Navami pooja. ABVP allegedly tried to stop non-veg from being cooked in Kaveri hostel mess. As per ABVP, however, Left-wing students tried to disrupt Ram Navami pooja. Police have been called in.

335.title: I am serious: Musk on poll to turn Twitter headquarters into homeless shelter
335.article_body: Elon Musk, the world's richest person and Twitter's biggest shareholder, tweeted, "I'm serious about this", about a poll to turn Twitter headquarters in San Francisco into a homeless shelter. At the time of writing, over 91% of the respondents had voted in favour of turning the Twitter headquarters into a homeless shelter. Musk was recently named to Twitter's board.

336.title: 1,222 bodies found in Kyiv region so far: Ukrainian official
336.article_body: Ukraine's Prosecutor General Iryna Venediktova on Sunday said that 1,222 bodies have been found in the region around Kyiv so far. The areas around Ukraine's capital were recently retaken by Ukrainian forces during a retreat by Russian forces in northern Ukraine. The Ukrainian government has accused the Russian forces of committing atrocities against the civilians during their occupation.

337.title: Private taxidermy museum with over 1,000 stuffed animals found in Spain
337.article_body: Spain is investigating a businessman who owned a private taxidermy collection with more than 1,000 stuffed animals. The collection includes over 400 specimens from protected species and at least one specimen of a North African oryx, already extinct. Stuffed animals were found in two warehouses extending over 50,000 square metres on the outskirts of Spain's BÃ©tera.

338.title: Planning permanent military presence on our eastern borders: NATO chief
338.article_body: NATO is working to set up a permanent military presence along its eastern borders in a bid to counter any future Russian threat, Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg said. He added that the bloc is "in the midst of a very fundamental transformation", which will reflect "long-term consequences" of Putin's actions. Stoltenberg's tenure as NATO chief has been extended till September 2023.

339.title: Capitan, you've done it again: Rana on RRR crossing â¹1,000 cr globally
339.article_body: Actor Rana Daggubati, taking to Twitter, congratulated filmmaker SS Rajamouli after his film 'RRR' crossed â¹1,000 crores globally after 16 days of its release. "'ONE INDIA ONE CINEMA' was...wishful dream till one man came along and said this is what it looks like!! Capitan, you've done it again," he tweeted. Rana and Rajamouli have worked together in the 'Baahubali' franchise.

340.title: BJP doesn't have patent for Hindutva: Uddhav Thackeray
340.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday said BJP doesn't hold the "patent for Hindutva" and that Shiv Sena has always been committed to bhagva (saffron) and Hindutva. "I wonder had Lord Ram not been born, what issue the BJP would have raised in politics. Since BJP is bereft of issues, it is talking about religion and [spreading] hatred," Thackeray said.

341.title: I had no idea, I just turned and saw him go off: Hetmyer on Ashwin retiring out
341.article_body: Talking about Ravichandran Ashwin retiring out in 19th over against LSG, RR's Shimron Hetmyer, who was the other batter on the pitch at the time, said, "I literally had no idea about it." He added, "I just turned and saw him go off. He was a...bit tired. It was a good decision as Riyan Parag hit a six," Hetmyer said.

342.title: Clashes break out during Ram Navami processions in 2 Gujarat cities
342.article_body: Clashes were reported during Ram Navami processions in Himmatnagar and Khambhat in Gujarat on Sunday. Two groups pelted stones at each other, damaged shops and vehicles, following which the police fired tear gas shells to control the situation. The number of injuries recorded in both incidents is not known yet, officials said.

343.title: Would be intimidated if I'm offered film with Hrithik Roshan: Shahid
343.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor said he would be intimidated if he is offered a film with actor Hrithik Roshan. "Because I...love Hrithik as an action hero and I really love him as a dancer so I would...be very nervous," Shahid stated. "I would tell him to do a bit of 'Haider' type role? Because that is my comfort zone," he added.

344.title: Was bathroom singer, thought why not take it seriously: Tiger Shroff
344.article_body: Tiger Shroff said he was a bathroom singer and added he sang well. "I thought why not take it seriously...I just wanted to start it as a hobby," he stated. "One of my goals in life was to perform on stage and sing...dance to my...songs," he added. Tiger made his singing debut in Bollywood with 'Heropanti 2' song 'Miss Hairan'.

345.title: Sri Lankan economic crisis may cause more deaths than COVID: Doctors
345.article_body: The economic crisis in Sri Lanka may lead to more deaths than those caused by COVID-19, according to Sri Lanka Medical Association (SLMA). All hospitals in the country no longer had access to imported medical tools and vital drugs, it claimed. "We're made to make very difficult choices. We've to decide who gets treatment and who will not," it said.

346.title: I bowl googlies more than leg-break as it turns more: RCB's Hasaranga
346.article_body: Royal Challengers Bangalore spinner Wanindu Hasaranga has said that he bowls googlies more than leg-spin deliveries because his googly "turns more than" his leg-break delivery. Speaking about his team's seven-wicket win over Mumbai Indians on Saturday, Hasaranga said, "Definitely happy with my performance, but happier with the team's win." Hasaranga scalped two wickets in the IPL 2022 match.

347.title: Video of Pak PM candidate knocking off mics during speeches goes viral
347.article_body: A video of Pakistan PM candidate Shehbaz Sharif knocking off microphones while delivering speeches has gone viral online. The video shows Sharif hitting mics with his hand gestures on several occasions while speaking at public events in Pakistan. "India mustn't take Shehbaz Sharif lightly. He's literally a mover and shaker," said one Twitter user on the video.

348.title: Don't know why I didn't get much work when I was younger: Ratna
348.article_body: Veteran actress Ratna Pathak Shah has stated that she doesn't know why she didn't get much work when she was younger, adding there was something about her that wasn't acceptable. "I was just not looked at, maybe because I was (Naseeruddin Shah's) wife and they thought I was just not interested in working. Thankfully that's done and dusted," Ratna added.

349.title: Carter and I would love to have twins: Paris Hilton
349.article_body: American socialite and businesswoman Paris Hilton has said that she would "love" to have twins with her husband Carter Reum. "I would like a twin boy and girl just to, like, get both...I would love that or twin girls because I love girls," she told the People magazine. Paris and Carter tied the knot in November last year.

350.title: Tunisians rally against Prez Saied, accuse him of 'failed dictatorship'
