350.article_body: Thousands of Tunisians took to the streets in capital Tunis to protest against President Kais Saied, accusing him of imposing one-man rule in Tunisia after he dissolved parliament last month. "We are facing a failed dictatorship...We will continue to protest...until...coup is forced to reverse its decisions," a protester said. Saied also dissolved Tunisia's Supreme Judicial Council in February.

351.title: BJP gave freedom to UP's private schools to raise fees: Sisodia
351.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Sunday said BJP-led Uttar Pradesh government has given the state's private schools the freedom to increase their fees. "Within 10 days of government formation...[Punjab] CM Bhagwant Mann issued an order saying private schools cannot increase their fees," Sisodia said. Delhi's private schools have been stopped from arbitrarily increasing fees since 2015, he added.

352.title: UP vegetable sellers' daughter Mumtaz stars in junior women's hockey World Cup
352.article_body: Mumtaz Khan, the 19-year-old daughter of vegetable sellers Qaiser Jahan and Hafiz Khan from Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow, helped India beat S Korea in the junior women's hockey World Cup quarterfinal on Friday. "I would've loved to watch her score the goal, but I've got to earn a living as well," her mother, who was selling vegetables during Mumtaz's match, said.

353.title: Ravichandran Ashwin becomes first cricketer to be retired out in IPL history
353.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin has become the first cricketer to be retired out in IPL history. Ashwin left the field in the 19th over of RR's innings against LSG after scoring 28(23). A batter is considered retired out if he retires his innings without the umpire's permission and cannot resume the innings.

354.title: Andhra CM inducts 14 new ministers into Cabinet in massive reshuffle
354.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy has reconstituted his Cabinet and inducted 14 new ministers. He has retained 11 ministers, including Deputy CM K Narayanaswamy, Women and Child Welfare Minister Taneti Vanita and Social Welfare Minister Pinipe Viswarupu. The revamped Cabinet will see 68% representation from Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes and Backward Classes.

355.title: Worry about your own kids: KhloÃ© to trolls saying she holds daughter too much
355.article_body: Television personality KhloÃ© Kardashian took to Twitter to react to trolls saying that she holds her daughter 'too much' after she carried her during the Los Angeles premiere of 'The Kardashians'. "I'm gonna hold my baby until I can't hold her anymore...When there's tons of cameras around...I want my baby to feel safe. Worry about your own children," she wrote.

356.title: Youâll get Twitter verification back, even if you shorted Tesla: Musk to investor
356.article_body: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded after American investor Michael Burry, who was portrayed in the movie 'The Big Short', said he was no longer a verified user on Twitter. "You will get it back, even though you shorted Tesla," Musk, the largest shareholder of Twitter, said. Burry ditched his bearish bets against Musk-led Tesla last year.

357.title: Russian rocket attack completely destroyed Dnipro airport: Ukraine
357.article_body: Russian forces fired rockets into Ukraine's Dnipro on Sunday, completely destroying an airport in the city, a local official said. Attacks on the city, which lies on the banks of Dnieper River, intensified on Sunday, the official added. Five staffers of the state emergency service were wounded by the strike on the airport, the head of Dnipro region council said.

358.title: Cong neither Indian nor national, only brother-sister party: Nadda
358.article_body: While addressing a gathering in Himachal Pradesh's Bilaspur, BJP president Jagat Prakash Nadda on Sunday said that Congress is neither Indian nor national, but only a brother-sister party. He further said, "Apart from BJP, there is no political party in the country that runs without promoting familism, many opposition parties have become regional parties only."

359.title: Important to have a second income to be choosy: Angad Hasija
359.article_body: Television actor Angad Hasija has stated that it is important to have a second income if one wants to be choosy with roles, else they would have to do whatever is offered. He is also a qualified architect and interior designer. "[My mom] wanted me to be an actor and that is how I came in this field," Angad added.

360.title: Sitaram Yechury re-elected as CPI(M) General Secretary for 3rd term
360.article_body: Sitaram Yechury was re-elected as General Secretary of CPI(M) for a third consecutive term at party's 23rd congress meet in Kerala's Kannur on Sunday. A 17-member politburo and 85-member central committee was also inducted at meet. Yechury, who was first elected to the post in 2015, had succeeded senior party leader Prakash Karat, who held the post for 10 years.

361.title: COVID-19 vaccines working against all variants: WHO chief scientist
361.article_body: COVID-19 vaccines are working against all variants of the SARS-CoV-2 virus at this point in time in preventing severe disease and death, said World Health Organisation (WHO) chief scientist Dr Soumya Swaminathan. "In the future, if we need to, we may have to change the composition of vaccines and we need to be prepared for that," she further said.

362.title: He's an idealist: Simi Garewal shares 2 learnings from Imran Khan's exit as Pak PM
362.article_body: Former actor and TV show host Simi Garewal on Sunday tweeted about what Imran Khan's exit as Pakistan PM taught her, saying, "1. A joint opposition can dismiss a popular Prime Minister. 2 Politics is no place for idealists." She added, "I've known Imran for 40 years and idealism is at his core."

363.title: Virat Kohli meets Baby AB after getting out to him, MI share video
363.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli met MI's Dewald Brevis, who is nicknamed Baby AB, after getting out to him in their IPL 2022 clash on Saturday. Kohli was adjudged LBW out on what was Brevis' first-ever delivery in IPL. "Young man! Good one, eh! Good first meeting. [Getting] me on the first ball," Kohli was heard telling Baby AB.

364.title: Bridge over dry river bed collapses as 138-wheel lorry crosses it in MP
364.article_body: A British-era bridge in Madhya Pradesh's Narmadapuram collapsed when a 138-wheel lorry was crossing it on the dry Sukthwa river. No injury was reported in the incident, Additional Superintendent of Police Awadhesh Pratap Singh said. After the incident, vehicular traffic was affected on the Bhopal-Nagpur highway and traffic was being diverted via Harda to Betul.

365.title: India accounts for 114 space debris, lowest in the last 4 years: NASA
365.article_body: Indian space assets account for 114 space debris, according to the latest issue of Orbital Debris Quarterly News published by NASA's Orbital Debris Program Office. India's contribution to space debris has fallen to the lowest levels in the last four years, the data showed. Earlier, NASA had said that India's anti-satellite test in 2019 had created "dangerous" space debris.

366.title: Jr NTR liked my story for 'NTR31', have been his big fan: Prashanth
366.article_body: Filmmaker Prashanth Neel, talking about his upcoming film with Jr NTR, has said the actor liked his story. "Please don't ask me about the genre of that movie because it's far off at the moment," he stated about the film that is tentatively titled 'NTR31'. Prashanth revealed he is a "big fan" of the actor for the last 20 years.

367.title: PM Modi & Biden to hold virtual meet tomorrow to 'deepen ties'
367.article_body: US President Joe Biden will hold a virtual meeting with PM Narendra Modi on Monday to "further deepen ties between our governments, economies, and our people", a US official said. "Biden will continue our close consultations on...consequences of Russia's brutal war against Ukraine," the official added. The meeting will precede the India-US 2+2 Ministerial Dialogue, the official further said.

368.title: Soni Razdan asked not to discuss it: Mukesh Bhatt on Alia-Ranbir wedding
368.article_body: Alia Bhatt's uncle filmmaker Mukesh Bhatt, on being asked about her wedding with Ranbir Kapoor, has stated that he is not in a position to say anything at this time. "My sister-in-law (Soni Razdan) has asked to refrain from discussing anything about this marriage," Mukesh added. Alia and Ranbir are reported to get married on April 14 in RK Studios.

369.title: BJP govt in UP has failed on all fronts: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav
369.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Sunday said that the Uttar Pradesh government has failed on all fronts and the BJP is insensitive towards the problems of the youth. Yadav further said that BJP wants to rule the state by making people feel afraid, "which is highly condemnable in a democracy," adding that BJP has defamed UP.

370.title: Ram Janmbhoomi Temple's construction will be completed by Dec 2023
370.article_body: The construction of the Ram Janmbhoomi Temple in Ayodhya is in full swing and will be completed by December 2023, Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Teerth Kshetra General Secretary Champat Rai said. "Efforts are being made to install Lord Ram's idol in the sanctum sanctorum of the temple in 2023," Rai added. Construction work was interrupted earlier due to the pandemic.

371.title: 17-yr-old beaten by girl's family over suspected relationship in Guj
371.article_body: Gujarat's Panchmahal Police on Sunday arrested five people for allegedly assaulting a 17-year-old boy and two of his friends on the suspicion that he was in a relationship with a girl from the village. Police registered an FIR after a video that purportedly shows the boy and his friends being beaten with sticks surfaced online, reports said.

372.title: Cattle smuggler killed in gunfight with police in Assam's Dhubri
372.article_body: A suspected cattle smuggler was killed in a gunfight with police in Assam's Dhubri district, officials said on Sunday. According to police, the deceased was shot in self-defence by officials, who were chasing the vehicle the former was travelling in the previous night. Over 40 people have been killed due to police action in state since May 2021, PTI reported.

373.title: People scream from their windows after a week of total lockdown in Shanghai
373.article_body: A video reportedly showing residents in China's Shanghai screaming from their balcony windows has gone viral online. The city of 26 million residents has been under total COVID-19 lockdown for a week and people aren't allowed to leave their homes even for essential supplies. Another video showed a drone appealing to people to 'control their soul's desire for freedom'.

374.title: I have craved for this day when I'm head down in work: Raj Arjun
374.article_body: Actor Raj Arjun has stated that he has craved the day when he is head down in work since his initial days. He added the rise of OTT has turned the tide in favour of artistes who fall back on their talent and grit. "Today, I am in a position where I can ask for a bound script," Raj said.

375.title: DC defend biggest total of IPL 2022 vs KKR as Kuldeep takes 4 wickets against his ex-team
375.article_body: DC defeated KKR by 44 runs to end their two-match losing streak and move to the sixth position on the IPL 2022 points table. DC put up the biggest total of IPL 2022 after scoring 215/5 in their 20 overs. DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav took four wickets against his former team as KKR were dismissed for 171 in 19.4 overs.

376.title: Sunak moves out of official UK residence amid row over Akshata's taxes: Reports
376.article_body: British Chancellor of the Exchequer Rishi Sunak has moved out of his Downing Street residence in London along with his family amid a row over his wife Akshata Murty's taxes, reports said on Sunday. Removal vans were reportedly spotted outside Sunak's Downing Street flat. Reports said the family will move into their newly-renovated luxury flat in Kensington.

377.title: Pro-Russian protests in Germany amid conflict in Ukraine
377.article_body: Pro-Russian protesters gathered in Germany on Sunday to protest against discrimination in the country towards Russians following the invasion of Ukraine. The protests included a 350-car motorcade, flying Russian and also a few German flags, in Hanover city. Around 2.35 lakh Russian citizens live in Germany, according to government statistics from late 2020.

378.title: Nitish Kumar will be CM till NDA govt exists in Bihar: JD(U) leader
378.article_body: Nitish Kumar will hold the post of Chief Minister of Bihar till the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) government remains in the state, Janata Dal (U) leader Upendra Kushwaha said on Sunday. He added that BJP was not pressurising Kumar to leave the post. "There is no dispute within JD(U) for the Chief Minister post in Bihar," Kushwaha said.

379.title: Have two pitches for Mahesh Babu: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli
379.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli, speaking about his upcoming project with actor Mahesh Babu, has said that he has two pitches for the actor. "When 'RRR' was postponed due to Omicron variant, my father Vijayendra Prasad, ordered me not to stay idle at home. We started dabbling with a couple of ideas," Rajamouli stated. "Both of them are exciting...large-scale movies," he added.

380.title: Driver falls from road roller, dies after coming under its wheels in UP
380.article_body: The driver of a road roller died after he fell from the vehicle and came under its rear wheel in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi on Saturday. The 40-year-old man lost control over the vehicle after a high-tension electric wire fell on it. He was working on a rural road project in the Gopiganj area of Bhadohi.

381.title: Russia seeking to recruit discharged soldiers amid Ukraine war: UK
381.article_body: UK's Defence Ministry claimed on Sunday that Russia is seeking to strengthen its troop numbers in Ukraine by recruiting military personnel who were discharged from services in 2012. Russia is also trying to employ soldiers from Transnistria, a breakaway region in Moldova, the ministry further claimed. This comes amid reports of Russia regrouping its troops in eastern Ukraine.

382.title: UK FM Sunak considered resigning over criticism of wife's tax status: Report
382.article_body: UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak considered whether he should resign after facing criticism over his wife Akshata Murty's non-domiciled tax status, The Sunday Times reported. "He was considering whether he could withstand his family taking this any more," the newspaper quoted a source as saying. Murty's non-domiciled tax status meant she didn't have to pay UK taxes on global earnings.

383.title: UK probes leak of Finance Minister Sunak's wife's tax affairs: Reports
383.article_body: The UK has reportedly launched a Whitehall inquiry into how the tax affairs of Finance Minister Rishi Sunak's wife Akshata Murty were leaked to the media. Sunak was recently criticised after it was revealed that Akshata holds a non-domiciled status in the UK. Following the row, Akshata said that she will start paying UK taxes on her overseas income.

384.title: New Pak govt will not indulge in politics of revenge: Shehbaz Sharif
384.article_body: Shehbaz Sharif, who has been nominated as the next PM of Pakistan, on Sunday claimed that the new government in the country will not indulge in politics of revenge. "I don't want to go back to bitterness of...past. We want to forget them and move forward," he said. Earlier, Imran Khan had lost the no-trust vote in the National Assembly.

385.title: LSG to bowl first against RR, both teams make two changes
385.article_body: LSG won the toss and elected to bowl first against RR in their IPL 2022 clash. LSG have made two changes to their playing XI, with Marcus Stoinis and Dushmantha Chameera replacing Evin Lewis and Andrew Tye, respectively. RR have also made two changes, with Rassie van der Dussen and Kuldeep Sen replacing Yashasvi Jaiswal and Navdeep Saini, respectively.

386.title: Each of 403 Assembly segments in UP to have 100-bed hospitals: Yogi
386.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Sunday inaugurated a statewide health campaign and said that each of the 403 Assembly segments in UP will have a 100-bed hospital. "Encephalitis came under control in the past four years. The deadly encephalitis will be eradicated forever in one to two years," Yogi said while launching the Jan Arogya Mela in UP.

387.title: My wife Maanayata pushed me to do 'K.G.F: Chapter 2': Sanjay Dutt
387.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt has revealed that his wife Maanayata Dutt pushed him to do the upcoming film 'K.G.F: Chapter 2'. The actor further said that the journey of the film has been a lesson for him after 45 years. "This film was made as a family," he added. This is Sanjay's first film since his recovery from lung cancer.

388.title: Japan & Philippines agree to enhance defence cooperation at 2+2 meeting
388.article_body: Japan and the Philippines agreed to enhance their defence cooperation at the countries' first-ever 2+2 meeting in Tokyo on Saturday. The countries affirmed their commitment to ensuring a "free and open Indo-Pacific" region, according to a statement released by Japan's Foreign Ministry. Notably, the countries have maritime disputes with China in the East and South China seas.

389.title: EV retail sales witness three-fold jump in FY22: Industry body
389.article_body: Federation of Automobile Dealers Association (FADA) said electric vehicle (EV) retail sales in India witnessed a three-fold jump YoY from 1,34,821 units sold in FY21 to 4,29,217 units sold in FY22. "Total EV sales had stood at 1,68,300 units in FY20," it further said. Tata Motors led the segment with 15,198 units sold and a market share of 85.37%.

390.title: Wish I could tell myself at 23 not to be impulsive: Raveena
390.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon has stated that when she was 23 years old, she was a grounded person but super sensitive and a bit impulsive. "I wish I could tell myself then that work in time heals everything and tell myself not to be impulsive," she added. The actress further said she had to deal with yellow journalism at the time.

391.title: 27-yr-old Pune woman harassed over extra marital affair dies by suicide
391.article_body: A 27-year-old woman in Pune died by suicide after allegedly being harassed by her husband and in-laws for being involved in an extra-marital affair, police said. Investigating Officer API Manohar Sonwane said that the accused have been arrested for harassing her mentally and physically, which led the victim to take the extreme step.

392.title: AAP leader attacked with chopper by 3 minors in Pune
392.article_body: President of Aam Aadmi Party's social justice wing in Pimpri Chinchwad, Yashwant Shrimant Kamble was allegedly attacked with a chopper by three minors when he was returning home from a protest on Saturday. Kamble was returning on his two-wheeler when motorcycle-borne attackers came from behind and hit him with a sharp weapon believed to be a chopper, reports said.

393.title: UK PM travels in train to reach war-hit Ukraine; video of train surfaces
393.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson travelled on a train from Poland to Ukraine to meet the war-hit country's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy recently. In a clip shared by the Ukrainian Railways online, the UK PM said, "I am travelling on a fantastic train through to Kyiv from Poland." On meeting Zelenskyy, Johnson said, "Ukrainians have shown the courage of a lion."

394.title: Chris Rock jokes about Will Smith's Oscars slap, says 'got my hearing back'
394.article_body: Comedian Chris Rock joked about actor Will Smith slapping him at the 94th Academy Awards during a recent standup show. "I'm okay...I'm not talking about [the slapping incident] until I get paid. Life is good. I got my hearing back," Chris joked. This comes after Will received a 10-year ban from attending the Oscars because of the incident.

395.title: Protest outside Sri Lankan Prez's office continues for 2nd day
395.article_body: Sri Lankan protesters continued to occupy the entrance of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's office for a second day on Sunday amid a severe economic crisis in the country. The crisis has led to a shortage of essential items in Sri Lanka. "We will stay on, we will leave only when we have chased them out," a 32-year-old former soldier said.

396.title: Thane woman killed, 2 injured as portion of adjoining house collapses
396.article_body: A 45-year-old woman was killed and two other persons were injured after the balcony of an adjacent house collapsed on their residence in the Thane district of Maharashtra on Sunday, officials said. The injured persons were taken to a local hospital, from where they were shifted to Mumbai for further treatment. One of the injured persons is aged 45.

397.title: Qutub Minar was built after demolishing 27 Hindu-Jain temples: VHP
397.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad Spokesman Vinod Bansal on Sunday said Qutub Minar was built "with material obtained after demolishing 27 Hindu-Jain temples". "Qutub Minar was actually 'Vishnu Stambh'...The superimposed structure was built just to tease the Hindu community," Bansal added. He also demanded that the 27 demolished temples be rebuilt and Hindus be allowed to offer prayers there.

398.title: 12 crude bombs used for killing pigs found in a field in Pune
398.article_body: Pune's Dighi Police recovered 12 crude bombs, used to kill pigs and stray animals, popularly known as dukkar (pig bombs), from Wadmukhwadi on Friday. According to the police, the bombs were spotted by a woman, whose five-year-old daughter was killed by the same explosives in February, when the child tried to play with it, not knowing it was a bomb.

399.title: Pics show Kapoors' bungalow being lit up ahead of Ranbir, Alia's rumoured wedding
399.article_body: Pictures have shown lights being put up at a bungalow belonging to actor Ranbir Kapoor's family, ahead of his rumoured wedding with Alia Bhatt on April 17. Visuals showed Krishna Raj Bungalow being lit up, even as reports said that some wedding rituals will be performed there. The couple will reportedly move into the bungalow after their wedding.

400.title: NCB busts illegal drug supply chain in Kolkata, arrests 4 people
400.article_body: Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) busted an illegal drug supply chain in Kolkata and arrested four people on Friday. NCB raided a godown of accused, identified as Minagur Rahaman, who is allegedly involved in retail sale of psychotropic substances, and recovered injections, cough syrups and capsules. One of the seized drugs is used to treat addiction to opioids, NCB added.

401.title: Delhi govtâs parent outreach programme yet to cover 250 schools
401.article_body: A report on the Delhi government's parent outreach programme launched last year found that it is yet to cover 250 schools. A report submitted by the Delhi Commission for Protection of Child Rights said that out of the 1,068 government schools, School Management Committee (SMC) members and school mitras had done no interactions with parents in 250 schools.

402.title: K'taka govt hands over probe into B'luru road rage killing to CID
402.article_body: The Karnataka government has handed over the probe into the road rage incident, in which a 22-year-old man was killed in Bengaluru to CID, state Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said. "I have instructed higher officials of the police department. Our officials have collected evidence," he added. The victim was stabbed to death by three men in JJ Nagar on Tuesday.

403.title: Sony TV's Kaun Banega Crorepati registrations are now open
403.article_body: Sony Entertainment Television has opened online registrations for the upcoming fourteenth season of Kaun Banega Crorepati. Starting April 9, host Mr. Amitabh Bachchan will ask a new question everyday at 9pm, giving aspirants a chance to be India's next crorepati with the power of their knowledge, Sony Entertainment Television announced.

404.title: Delhi Capitals record highest total of IPL 2022
404.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) put up a total of 215/5 against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) on Sunday to record the highest total of IPL 2022 so far and their fourth highest total in IPL history. It is the eighth time that DC have scored more than 200 runs in an innings in IPL. DC slammed 11 sixes in their innings today.

405.title: Coinbase suspends UPI payments option in India days after launch
405.article_body: US-based crypto exchange Coinbase has disabled the option to buy cryptocurrencies using UPI method in India. The development comes days after Coinbase launched its trading services in India and said it would allow users to buy crypto using UPI. After the launch, the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) had clarified it wasn't aware of any crypto exchange using UPI.

406.title: India's 5th richest man Damani reduces Blue Dart stake, hikes stake in VST: Report
406.article_body: Radhakishan Damani, DMart owner and India's fifth-richest person with a net worth of $20 billion according to Forbes, has increased his shareholding in Hyderabad-based cigarettes company VST Industries, The Economic Times reported. He bought 12,000 equity shares of VST Industries during the January-March period. He decreased in logistics company Blue Dart Express in the March 2022 quarter.
